# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree-Law No. 65 of 2025
### Amending the Penal Code
### Issued by Law No. (16) of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And Penal Code issued by Law No. (16) of 1960 and its amending laws,
- And Law of Criminal Procedures and Trials issued by Law No. (17) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Law of Civil and Commercial Procedures issued by Decree-Law No. (38) of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The texts of Articles Nos. (44, first paragraph, 154, 164) of the aforementioned Penal Code shall be replaced with the following texts:

**Article (44, First Paragraph):**
Unintentional error shall be deemed to exist if the perpetrator, when committing the act, behaved in a manner that an ordinary person would not, if placed in the same circumstances, by acting with recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, or disregard for laws and regulations.

**Article (154):**
Whoever kills a person by mistake or unintentionally causes their death, if such act resulted from recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, or non-observance of laws and regulations, or from a breach of the principles of their job, profession, or craft, shall be punished by imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and not less than five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

**Article (164):**
Whoever unintentionally causes injury to another or inflicts tangible harm upon them, if such act resulted from recklessness, negligence, carelessness, inattention, or non-observance of laws and regulations, or from a breach of the principles of their job, profession, or craft, shall be punished by imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year and a fine not exceeding five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and not less than two hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

(Article Two)
Two new articles, numbered (154 bis, 164 bis), shall be added to the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, with the following texts:

The killing mentioned in the preceding article shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years and a fine not exceeding two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and not less than one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if the killing is associated with any of the following circumstances:
1- The perpetrator's consumption of an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance that affects a person's natural faculties.
2- If the perpetrator's act results in the death of two or more persons.
3- The perpetrator's refusal or negligence to assist the victim at the time of committing the act, while being capable of doing so.
The penalty shall be imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years and a fine not exceeding ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or one of these two penalties, if two or more of the circumstances stipulated in the preceding paragraph are combined.

**(Article (164 bis):**
The injury mentioned in the preceding article shall be punishable by imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and not less than five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or by one of these two penalties, if it is associated with any of the following circumstances:
1- The perpetrator's consumption of an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance that affects a person's natural faculties.
2- If the perpetrator's act results in injury to two or more persons.
3- If the perpetrator's act results in the victim suffering a permanent disability.
4- The perpetrator's refusal or negligence to assist the victim at the time of committing the act, while being capable of doing so.
The penalty shall be imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and not less than one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or one of these two penalties, if two or more of the circumstances stipulated in the preceding paragraph are combined.

**(Article Three)**
A new clause numbered (8) titled (Debtor's Evasion of Payment) shall be added to Chapter Three (Crimes Against Property) of Book Three (Crimes Against Individuals) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, containing new articles numbered (283, 284, 285, 286) with the following texts:

**Article (283):**
Every debtor who commits any of the following acts shall be punished by imprisonment for a term not exceeding three years and a fine not exceeding five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, or by one of these two penalties:
1- Concealing, absconding with, or disposing of their assets by illicit traditional or electronic means with the intent of not fulfilling their debts established by an enforceable instrument.
2- Acknowledging debts not owed by them, or reducing their assets or rights due from others, with the intent of not fulfilling their debts established by an enforceable instrument.
The criminal case shall lapse, regardless of its stage, if the accused pays the value of the debt, reconciles with the creditor, or is pardoned by them.
If payment, reconciliation, or pardon occurs after a final judgment of conviction has been issued, the court that issued the judgment may order the suspension of the imposed penalty upon the request of the convicted person.

# Explanatory Memorandum
## For Decree-Law No. 65 of 2025

Amending the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960. The penal punishment stipulated by law is considered a cornerstone in building the general theory of crime. This punishment is keenly observed by the legislator and the judge, and it is relied upon by the hearts of citizens and residents alike; for without it, the articles of law would be nothing more than moral advice, heeded by those who wish and defied by those who wish.

For punishment to achieve its purpose of instilling security and tranquility in society and quenching the thirst for justice in the judiciary, it must reach a level where individuals are deterred and compelled to think carefully before engaging in wrongful conduct or refraining from an act commanded by the legislator.

The accompanying draft Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig> has been introduced to amend the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, aiming for the following:
- Firstly: Addressing the decline in caution and prudence among individuals and the resulting injuries and deaths.
- Secondly: Protecting the credit process in the country from debtors who misrepresent their true financial position and attempt to portray it as a state of insolvency.
- Firstly: Manslaughter <orig>القتل الخطأ</orig> and Accidental Injury <orig>الإصابة الخطأ</orig>. It is evident that the crimes of manslaughter and accidental injury have not undergone any amendment since the issuance of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> in 1960, neither in terms of increasing the financial values of the fine penalty nor in terms of introducing aggravating circumstances when associated with the material element constituting both crimes. This is despite what reality reveals regarding a breach in the aspect of caution and prudence among individuals and their lack of deep insight into the actions they undertake and their consequences, especially if it results in multiple deaths or permanent disability. Justice refuses to treat all assumptions equally.

Therefore, the accompanying draft proposes raising the maximum fine penalty in Articles (154) and (164), and adding one form of error, which is non-observance of laws, in both mentioned articles and Article (44) in its first paragraph, to eliminate any dispute raised regarding its omission.

The draft also added two new articles, (154 bis) and (164 bis), which address the aggravating circumstances for the crimes of manslaughter <orig>القتل الخطأ</orig> and accidental injury <orig>الإصابة الخطأ</orig>. These circumstances can be categorized into three sections: the first relates to the gravity of the error, the second relates to the gravity of the criminal outcome, and the third relates to the combination of more than one party connected to the gravity of the error or the gravity of the harm, or both, as follows:
### Circumstances related to the gravity of the error:
1- That the perpetrator consumes an intoxicating, narcotic, psychotropic, or any other substance that affects the person's natural faculties, and is under its influence while committing the act described as an error. The reason for considering it grave is that intoxication, narcosis, or influence on the mind or any other faculties concerned with directing will, reduces awareness and weakens a person's control over their will, thereby diminishing the accused's ability to take precautions and caution that, if followed, would not have

## Article (284):
Anyone who receives, obtains, possesses, or has transferred to them the debtor's funds, whether by traditional or electronic means, with knowledge of the debt established by an executive instrument, with the intent of enabling the debtor to avoid payment, shall be punished with the same penalty specified in the preceding article. This provision does not apply to persons under the guardianship or tutelage of the debtor.

The criminal case shall lapse, regardless of its stage, if the funds are handed over to the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> or the investigation authority <orig>جهة التحقيق</orig> in preparation for the recovery of the debt from the debtor according to the rules of creditor priority.

If the funds are handed over after a final judgment of conviction has been issued, the court that issued the judgment may order the suspension of the execution of the imposed penalty upon the request of the convicted person.

The effect of debt payment, settlement, or pardon stipulated in the preceding article shall apply to anyone who received, obtained, possessed, or had transferred to them the debtor's funds.

## Article (285):
Any debtor who disposes of their assets or rights for less than their market price or value, with a noticeable difference, intending thereby not to fulfill their debts established by an executive instrument, shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding two years and a fine not exceeding three thousand Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

The effect of debt payment, settlement, or pardon stipulated in Article (283) shall apply to the accused in accordance with the provisions of this article.

## Article (286):
The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall have jurisdiction over the investigation, disposition, and prosecution of the crimes mentioned in this section.

## (Article Four)
Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

## Approving Accession to the Agreement Establishing the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank

*   Having reviewed the Constitution,
*   And Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to May 10, 2024,
*   And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations, and its amending decrees,
*   And based on the presentation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
*   And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
*   We have issued the following Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig>:

### Article One

Approval of accession to the Agreement Establishing the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, the texts of which are attached to this Decree-Law <orig>المرسوم بقانون</orig>.

## Explanatory Memorandum <orig>المذكرة الإيضاحية</orig>
### Regarding Decree-Law No. 66 of 2025 Approving Accession to the Agreement Establishing the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank <orig>البنك الآسيوي للاستثمار في البنية التحتية</orig>

Given the importance of regional cooperation to sustain growth and promote economic and social development for economies in Asia, and thereby contribute to regional resilience against potential financial crises and other external shocks, the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank <orig>البنك الآسيوي للاستثمار في البنية التحتية</orig> was established through the aforementioned Agreement.

The Preamble stated that the establishment of the Bank as a multilateral financial institution focused on infrastructure development would help mobilize much-needed additional resources from within and outside Asia and remove financing bottlenecks faced by individual economies in Asia.

Chapter One included the purpose, functions, and membership, where it clarified

And he did it. It goes without saying that the text does not apply to those who consume such substances by force or without knowledge, as it is considered that the grounds for exemption from liability stipulated in Article (23) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> would be available to them.

2- An aggravating circumstance <orig>الظرف المشدد</orig> is present if the accused, at the time of committing the incident, refrained from or neglected to assist the victim of the crime in any way; including seeking assistance for them. This circumstance assumes that the accused was able to prevent the criminal outcome, either by their own means or by seeking assistance from others, but failed to do so and showed disregard for it, leaving it uncared for, or neglected to take action to assist. The aggravation stipulates that the accused added a second error to their initial act, represented by their failure to avert the harmful effects of their wrongful conduct.

Circumstances related to the gravity of the criminal outcome:
These are either the multiplicity of victims in involuntary manslaughter <orig>جريمة القتل غير العمد</orig> or if the accused's act resulted in injury to two or more persons or permanent disability. Although the multiplicity of victims in involuntary manslaughter or accidental injury would lead to a multiplicity of crimes committed by the perpetrator, the draft law deemed it appropriate to add the multiplicity of victims as an aggravating circumstance <orig>ظرف مشدد</orig>, which in this case prevents the multiplicity of crimes, and thus there is one crime with multiple victims.

Circumstances related to the combination of more than one aggravating circumstance:
This also applies if two or more of the circumstances mentioned in Articles (154) bis and (164) bis are present.

Secondly: Crimes related to a Debtor's Nearness to Payment <orig>جرائم قرب المدين من الوفاء</orig>
The draft law introduced a new section in Chapter Three (Crimes Against Property) of Book Three (Crimes Against Individuals) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> under the heading (8) "Crimes related to a Debtor's Nearness to Payment <orig>قرب المدين من الوفاء</orig>", adding four new articles from (283) to (286) concerning a debtor who seeks to weaken their financial solvency and present it as a state of insolvency, intending to evade payment of debts established by executive instruments, or to dispose of assets for less than their market value with a significant, unforgivable difference. The draft law also extended criminal protection to the debtor's assets that are transferred or delivered to other parties who are aware of the debt established by the executive instrument and for which enforcement procedures are being taken to collect it, with the intention of enabling the debtor to avoid paying their debts, even if these parties are their spouse, ascendants, or descendants, with the exception of persons under the debtor's guardianship or tutelage, as liability does not extend to them given that the management of their assets is entrusted to the debtor. The draft law stipulated the effect of debt payment on criminal proceedings and settlement procedures issued by the creditor. It assigned the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> the jurisdiction to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute these crimes.

Thus, the draft law came as an affirmation of the protection of individuals' lives and credit operations in the country, signaling the necessity of clear and unambiguous dignity for the crimes associated with the accompanying draft, and as a deterrent to those who violate its provisions, achieving a balance between protecting the interests of society and ensuring the rights and freedoms of individuals.

Finally, it was decided that the provisions of the draft law shall come into effect one month after the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, in accordance with the text of Article (178) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.

Article (1) Purpose: The purpose of establishing the Bank is to promote sustainable economic development and wealth creation, as well as to foster regional cooperation and partnership in addressing development challenges. Article (2) included the functions performed by the Bank, whereby the Bank undertakes to encourage investment in public and private capital, utilize the resources available to the Bank to finance projects in the region, encourage private investment in projects, companies, and activities that contribute to economic development, and also undertake other activities and provide other services that may enhance these functions. Article (3) stipulated membership in the Bank. Chapter Two referred to Capital. Article (4) defined the authorized capital of the Bank. Article (5) addressed subscription to shares, whereby each member shall subscribe to shares of the Bank's capital, and the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> shall determine the initial number of shares to be subscribed by countries admitted to membership. The Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> may increase a member's subscription according to the terms and conditions determined by the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> by a supermajority vote. The Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> shall review the authorized capital at intervals not exceeding five years. Article (6) stipulated the payment of subscriptions, whereby the initial subscription amount shall be paid by each signatory to this Agreement. Each installment of the initial subscriptions to the original capital shall be paid in dollars or any other convertible currency. The amount paid for subscription to callable shares is subject to call only when summoned by the Bank to meet its obligations. The Bank shall accept from any member payment in the form of promissory notes or any other obligations issued by the member's government. Article (7) included the specific conditions for shares. Article (8) addressed the ordinary resources of the Bank, where the term 'ordinary resources' includes the Bank's authorized capital, funds raised by the Bank under the powers granted to it, as well as funds received as repayment of loans and revenues derived from loans provided from the aforementioned funds, and any other funds and revenues received by the Bank. Chapter Three defined the Bank's operations. Article (9) addressed the use of resources, whereby the Bank's resources and facilities shall be used exclusively for the implementation of its purposes and functions in accordance with sound banking principles. Article (10) clarified the Bank's operations, which consist of ordinary and special operations. Article (11) specified the recipients of financing and the operating methods by which the Bank conducts its operations. Article (12) addressed restrictions on ordinary operations, whereby the total outstanding amount of loans, equity investments, and guarantees shall not be increased if such increase would cause the total amount to exceed the aggregate of the unimpaired subscribed capital, reserves, and retained earnings included in the Bank's ordinary resources. The Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> may increase the aforementioned limit to 250% of the fully subscribed capital, reserves, and retained earnings included in the Bank's ordinary resources. Furthermore, the amount of the Bank's investments in issued shares shall not at any time exceed an amount equivalent to its total subscribed and fully paid-up capital and general reserves. Article (13) stipulated the operating principles by which the Bank's operations are conducted. Article (14) addressed the terms and conditions of financing. Article (15) included technical assistance, whereby the Bank may provide advice and technical assistance. Chapter Four regulated the Bank's financing operations. Article (16) clarified the general powers of the Bank. Article (17) addressed special funds designed to serve the purpose and fall within the Bank's functions. Special funds accepted by the Bank may be used according to terms and conditions consistent with the Bank's purpose and functions. The Bank shall adopt special rules and regulations that may be necessary for the establishment, administration, and use of all special funds. Article (18) addressed the allocation and distribution of the Bank's net income. Article (19) referred to currencies, whereby members shall not impose any restrictions on currencies. Article (20) addressed the methods of meeting the Bank's obligations. Chapter Five dealt with Governance, where Article (21) defined the structure. Articles (22), (23), and (24) covered the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> in terms of its composition, powers, and the procedures followed for holding meetings. Articles (25), (26), and (27) clarified the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in terms of its composition, powers, and the procedures followed for holding meetings. Article (28) included voting in the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig> and the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. Article (29) addressed the President of the Bank <orig>رئيس البنك</orig>, how he is elected, his term of office, and his competencies. Article (30) clarified the officers and staff of the Bank. Article (31) referred to the international status of the Bank. Chapter Six included General Provisions, where Article (32) covered the Bank's offices. Article (33) regulated the channel of communication and the depositories designated by each member. Article (34) addressed reports and information and considered English to be the official language of the Bank. Article (35) referred to the Bank's cooperation with members and international organizations. Article (36) clarified the references contained in this Agreement.
Chapter Seven regulated the withdrawal and suspension of members, where Article (37) stipulated withdrawal from membership, Article (38) regulated suspension of membership, and Article (39) covered the settlement of accounts. Chapter Eight dealt with the suspension and termination of the Bank's operations, where Article (40) stipulated the temporary suspension of operations, Article (41) regulated the termination of operations, Article (42) addressed the responsibility of members and the settlement of claims, and Article (43) defined the distribution of assets. Chapter Nine included Status, Immunities, Privileges, and Exemptions, where Article (44) stipulated the purposes of the Chapter, and Article (45) clarified the status of the Bank, whereby the Bank shall possess full juridical personality and legal capacity. Article (46) addressed immunity from judicial proceedings, whereby the Bank shall enjoy immunity from all forms of legal proceedings except those related to the collection of funds, and no action may be brought against the Bank by any member. Members shall resort to special procedures for settling disputes between the Bank and its members as stipulated in this Agreement and in the Bank's rules and regulations or in contracts concluded with the Bank. The Bank's property and assets shall enjoy immunity against all forms of seizure, attachment, or confiscation prior to the issuance of a final judgment against the Bank. Article (47) clarified the immunity of assets and archives. Article (48) clarified the freedom of assets from restrictions, whereby all property and assets of the Bank shall be free from restrictions, regulations, controls, and moratoriums of any nature whatsoever. Article (49) stipulated communications privileges. Article (50) clarified the immunities and privileges of officials and staff. Article (51) clarified tax exemption, whereby the Bank, its assets, property, income, operations, and transactions shall be exempt from all taxes and customs duties. No taxes shall be levied in respect of salaries, emoluments, and expenses paid by the Bank to directors, alternates, the President, and other officials or staff of the Bank. No taxes of any kind shall be imposed on any obligations or guarantees issued by the Bank, nor shall any taxes of any kind be imposed on any obligations or guarantees guaranteed by the Bank. Article (52) permitted the waiver of any of the privileges, immunities, and exemptions granted under this Chapter. Chapter Ten, in Articles (53), (54), and (55), dealt with Amendment, Interpretation, and Arbitration. Article (56) included the provision that consent shall be deemed given whenever the consent of any member is required before the Bank takes any action, unless the member submits an objection within a reasonable period determined by the Bank. Chapter Eleven regulated the Final Provisions. Article (57) addressed the signing and deposit of the Agreement. Article (58) referred to the ratification, acceptance, or approval of the Agreement. Article (59) addressed the entry into force of the Agreement. Finally, Article (60) addressed the inaugural meeting and the commencement of operations.

The purpose of this program is (1) to promote sustainable economic development, and to enrich and improve the overall healthy environment in Asia through investment in infrastructure and other developmental facilities; (2) to enhance regional cooperation in partnership to confront the challenges of natural disasters, and to provide prevention with macro development institutions and contribute to other purposes.
2. Upon investment in these objectives, an obligation arises for this "entity" regarding environmental areas and advanced partnership by and with the latest investors therein, and partners, as required by the Board of Independents <orig>مجلس المستقلين</orig> concerning all of this.

# Article (2) Objectives

For this purpose, the following tasks shall be available:

(a) Encouraging investment in public and private capital in macro-purpose activities, especially the development of infrastructure and other developmental facilities.
(b) Utilizing human resources for the development of project infrastructure in activities related to building those projects and programs that contribute significantly to promoting economic growth, providing job opportunities, and meeting the current needs of the population.
(c) Enhancing regional cooperation between countries and regional companies in promoting sustainable economic development, particularly in infrastructure and other developmental facilities, as well as exchanging ideas, expertise, and information that serve common objectives.
(d) Undertaking reforms, efficient activities, and the dissemination of purposes that may serve those functions.

The maximum amount refundable by each entity individually is three hundred and seventy Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 370), in the event that the entity fails to respond to the refund request within twenty (20) days from the date of submitting the request. This amount shall be calculated as follows: One hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 100) for each month of delay, up to a maximum of three months, and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 50) for each week of delay, up to a maximum of four weeks. The date of submission of the request shall be calculated from the date of depositing the original copy of the refund request by a judicial bailiff <orig>محضر قضائي</orig>, or from the date of depositing the refund request (1) from the date the refundable amount becomes due (2) from the date of receiving the original copy of the refund request (3) from the date the refundable amount becomes due.
2. The maximum amount refundable by the entity in the original capital <orig>رأس المال الأصلي</orig> is in the event that the other entity fails to remove the cause, and this is as per what is stipulated in paragraph (5) of this Article. This amount shall be calculated as follows: One hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 100) for each month of delay, up to a maximum of three months, and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 50) for each week of delay, up to a maximum of four weeks. The date of submission of the request shall be calculated from the date of depositing the original copy of the refund request by a judicial bailiff <orig>محضر قضائي</orig>, or from the date of depositing the refund request (1) from the date the refundable amount becomes due (2) from the date of receiving the original copy of the refund request (3) from the date the refundable amount becomes due.
3. The refund applicant shall submit a complaint in case of delay in refunding amounts in the original capital <orig>رأس المال الأصلي</orig>, within thirty days from the date the refundable amount becomes due. This amount shall be calculated as follows: One hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 100) for each month of delay, up to a maximum of three months, and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 50) for each week of delay, up to a maximum of four weeks. The date of submission of the request shall be calculated from the date of depositing the original copy of the refund request by a judicial bailiff <orig>محضر قضائي</orig>, or from the date of depositing the refund request (1) from the date the refundable amount becomes due (2) from the date of receiving the original copy of the refund request (3) from the date the refundable amount becomes due.
4. There must be written proof indicating that these refundable amounts are related to the original case, and that they have not been refunded by the other entity, and there must be written proof indicating that these refundable amounts are related to the original case, and that they have not been refunded by the other entity.
5. Any refund applicant who deems it their right may file a lawsuit with the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, and there must be written proof indicating that these refundable amounts are related to the original case, and that they have not been refunded by the other entity.
6. By committing to the full refundable amount or any other percentage, it shall be decided as per paragraph (10) of this Article. This amount shall be calculated as follows: One hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 100) for each month of delay, up to a maximum of three months, and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars (KWD 50) for each week of delay, up to a maximum of four weeks. The date of submission of the request shall be calculated from the date of depositing the original copy of the refund request by a judicial bailiff <orig>محضر قضائي</orig>, or from the date of depositing the refund request (1) from the date the refundable amount becomes due (2) from the date of receiving the original copy of the refund request (3) from the date the refundable amount becomes due.

## Article (14): Dispute Resolution and Legal Arbitration

## Article (22) Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> - Formation
1.  Two members shall be appointed to the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, one as a representative and another as an alternate. It is stipulated that the shareholders' representative must possess experience and competence, and must not have any conflicting interest that is not in line with the social development objectives of the shareholders.
2.  In the event that the representation is not exercised, other representatives shall be elected by the shareholders as proposed by the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>.
3.  Shareholders and owner-shareholders shall be represented based on a further appointment by the owners, and such representative shall have the right to defend the rights of the shareholders during meetings.

## Article (23) Shareholders' Duties and Powers
1.  All powers related to the leadership of the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>.
2.  The Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> shall undertake to exercise some or any of its powers, and shall be able to perform the following:
    a) Accepting summons from whomever it deems necessary.
    b) Expressing opinions on all tasks presented to it.
    c) Declaring the eligibility of any of the members.
    d) Deciding on complaints submitted by any individual or member upon referral by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
    e) Preparing the internal regulations governing its work, and submitting them to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for approval, after the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and the shareholders in due course and in accordance with the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>, pursuant to Article 25 of this Law.
    f) Electing the Chairman, suspending their work, or removing them from office, and reviewing other matters <orig>أمور أخرى</orig> related to them.
    g) Reviewing the independent annual report, and submitting the balance sheet and profit and loss statement to the shareholders.
    h) Determining the total amounts, allocations, and net profits for the shareholders.
    i) Appointing the auditor.
    j) Appointing consultants.

### Article (25) Board of Directors: Composition

    a) Three (3) independent members who shall be the competent members in
    b) Three (3) independent members who shall be the non-competent members.
    c) The members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be highly specialized and competent in economic and financial affairs, and shall be selected in accordance with the provisions of the Board of Directors Charter <orig>ميثاق مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and the Independents must be from an increased number of members who ensure their independence and status.
2.  The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, based on a recommendation from its Chairman <orig>رئيسه</orig> and based on its opinion, may increase or decrease all or follow a date as appropriate, the sufficient eligibility as stipulated in Article (20).

4. The primary and alternate members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must be citizens of the Gulf Cooperation Council <orig>مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> (GCC) states.     (a) Directors shall be considered resigned until their successors are chosen and assume their duties.
    (b) If a Director's position becomes vacant for a period exceeding one hundred and eighty (180) days, their alternate shall replace them and receive their salaries and benefits, effective from the date the position became vacant, after obtaining prior approval from the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig>.

    (d) The primary and alternate members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent those not from the Bank, unless otherwise agreed, and they may sign any documents required for participation in attending meetings.

**Article (25): Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and Powers**

The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall preside over and supervise the Bank's activities, establish its general policies, and, in order to achieve its objectives, exercise all powers delegated to it by the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig>, and in particular:
(a) Preparing the work of the Board of Governors <orig>مجلس المحافظين</orig>.
(b) Submitting recommendations to the Bank, with the approval of no less than three-quarters of the total votes of the Bank's members, regarding decisions on key operational and financial policies and the appointment of the Bank's President.
(c) Issuing other decisions with the approval of two-thirds of the total votes of the Bank's members, except as stated in Article 21 of these Bylaws, regarding matters requiring the approval of four-fifths of the total votes.
(d) Supervising and evaluating the Bank's management on an annual basis, and establishing an internal control mechanism in line with the principles of transparency, openness, accountability, and stability.
(e) Preparing the Bank's strategy, annual plan, and budget.

## Article (27): Board of Directors and its Meetings

1. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall periodically manage the Bank's affairs through its decisions as it deems appropriate, and shall, in particular, be aware of matters decided by the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> in its capacity, and by the required majority, through the text stipulated in Article (25) of these Articles of Association. The Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> or upon the request of (2/3) of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members
2. may call the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to an emergency meeting if there is not a specific number of members, not less than the majority, which is not less than two-thirds of the total voting power of the members.
3. The Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig> may decide on any change in the number of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, provided that a decision is issued with the same percentage of the total shareholder representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> without entitling them to the right to vote. Any member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> also has the right to request the inclusion of any matter on the agenda
4. of its meetings, provided that the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is notified thereof at least 7 days before the meeting. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall issue decisions by which the Council sends to the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> at an interval between meetings.

## Article (28): Voting

1. The voting committee for each member shall consist of the asset and liability settlement project, and shall be considered the founder if it represents this Article.
    (a) The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, through the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>, through the Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig>, through the Assistant Director <orig>المدير المساعد</orig>, shall exercise (13) percent of the total votes belonging to the founder, and all decisions taken shall be voted upon.
    (b) It is stipulated that after the settlement of assets, and before the payment of the Bank's capital funds, this shall be incumbent upon its owner.
    (c) The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall exercise (100) votes for each of the following members:
        (a) Any member shall be part of any ongoing work related to their obligations in the Bank, and shall have the right to vote on decisions taken, provided that notification is given at least 7 days before the meeting. All decisions taken shall be voted upon, provided that the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is notified thereof at least 7 days before the meeting.
2. When voting in the Shareholders' Council <orig>مجلس المساهمين</orig>, each shareholder has the right to cast votes representing their share.

## Article (29) The Chairman

1. The Shareholders' Council shall appoint, through a written and transparent process and based on merit, the Chairman, de facto Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of the Board of Directors, Director General, or any other official from among the members of the Authority. The Chairman, Director General, or any other official from among the members of the Authority may only be appointed by a majority.
2. The Chairman's term of office shall extend to five (5) years, and he may be re-elected for one term. The Chairman may be suspended or dismissed from his position by a decision of the Shareholders' Council by an absolute majority of votes from the section stipulated in Article (28).
    (a) In the event of the Chairman's inability to perform his duties, and in such cases, an absolute majority of two-thirds of the shareholders' representatives may approve or appoint a new Chairman in accordance with Paragraph 1 of this Article.
3. The Chairman has the right to preside over the Board of Directors but does not have the right to vote except for a casting vote in the event of a tie. He may participate in the meetings of the Shareholders' Council but does not have the right to vote therein.
4. The Chairman is the legal representative of the Authority, holds the position of temporary chairman of the Authority, and undertakes - in cooperation with the Board of Directors - the management of the Authority's affairs.

### Article (34): Reports and Information

## Chapter Seven
### Liquidation of Assets and Adjustment of Status

## Article (37) Assets of Ownership

1. Any member may withdraw from the Bank at any time by giving written notice to the Principal Director.
2. The withdrawal shall take effect and cease to be effective on the date specified in the notice, but in no case shall this date be earlier than the date of receipt of the notice by the Bank. The withdrawing member shall be bound by their obligations towards the Bank, as stipulated in this Agreement.
3. The withdrawing member shall remain responsible for all financial and legal obligations of the Bank that they bore on the effective date of their withdrawal, and shall settle all amounts due to the Bank in a timely manner. The member shall not bear any responsibility for obligations arising from the Bank's operations that occur after the effective date of their withdrawal.

## Article (38) Settlement Achievement

1. If any member of the Bank has remaining obligations towards the Bank, the Bank may use that member's balance to settle the Bank's financial obligations, as stipulated in Article (28).
2. The withdrawal of any member shall not affect their rights and obligations towards the Bank, as stipulated in this Article, unless otherwise provided.

## Article (223) Settlement of Accounts

1.  After the date on which the commencement of resolutions issued in this regard is determined, shareholders may not dispose of their shares except in accordance with what is stipulated in those resolutions, and the trading of shares on the stock exchange or other securities markets where the shares are listed must be suspended until the accounts are settled.
2.  In cases where the settlement of accounts results in the payment of cash amounts to shareholders, they shall have the right to receive interest on these amounts from the date of commencement of the settlement until the date of their payment. The resolution issued for the settlement shall determine the applicable interest rate.
3.  The company may purchase its own shares in accordance with the controls and conditions determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, provided that the following provisions are observed:
    (a) The company may not purchase its shares except through the securities market and at market price, unless its articles of association <orig>نظامها الأساسي</orig> stipulate otherwise.
    (b) The company must disclose its intention to purchase its shares at least five days prior to the specified purchase date.
    (c) The purchase of shares must be made from the company's funds available for distribution as profits, and in no case shall the company's purchase of its shares lead to a reduction of its capital below the legally prescribed minimum.
    (d) The company may not purchase its shares in any of the following cases:
        1.  If it is in a state of insolvency or would become insolvent if it purchased its shares.
        2.  If the value of its assets is insufficient to meet its obligations or would become so if it purchased its shares.
    (e) Shares purchased by the company are called "treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig>". These shares shall not have voting rights in shareholders' meetings and shall not be entitled to dividends.
    (f) The company must include treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig> among its assets in the balance sheet, and disclose in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report the number of these shares, their book value, and market value.
    (g) The company may sell the treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig> in its possession at a price not less than the purchase price, or allocate them to the company's employees as part of an employee incentive plan.
    (h) If the company does not sell the treasury shares <orig>أسهم الخزينة</orig> within one year from the date of their purchase, it must reduce its capital by the nominal value of these shares and follow the prescribed procedures for that.

## Article (55): Arbitration

If a dispute arises between the shareholders or among them concerning any matter related to this resolution, and the amount of the dispute exceeds 100,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, the dispute shall be resolved through arbitration in accordance with this Article. The number of arbitrators shall be three; each party shall select one arbitrator, and the two arbitrators shall select the third arbitrator. The seat of arbitration shall be in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and the Arabic language shall be the language of arbitration. The decision shall be issued by a majority of votes, and the arbitration award shall be final and binding on both parties. It shall not be subject to appeal by any means of appeal. The arbitration award may be enforced after obtaining an enforcement order from the competent court.

## Article (56): Amended Approval Procedures

At least, if the approval of any member is required, the period for such approval or disapproval shall not exceed three working days. The member shall be notified within a reasonable period regarding the approval of the resolution, and evidence of the resolution's approval must be included in the meeting minutes.

## Article (57): Signature and Deposit

1.  Amendment of the agreement concluded between the Government of the French Republic and the Technical Committee in this document regarding "Cooperation" dated December 31, 2015, and its submission by the governments of the concerned countries to the international organization.
2.  Sending a copy of the concluded agreement to all other parties that have acceded to this agreement.

    The probationary period for Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members holding executive positions in executive management is two years, and the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may extend it for one year. *   The representation percentage of the right purchase <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> is calculated from the total votes cast for candidates in the electoral district. The representation percentage for all right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must be from 15% to 100% of the votes. The percentage of votes cast, which is 100% in the elections, must not be less than those votes cast in the ballot. The percentage of the right purchase <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not exceed 100.
*   Among the candidates were the voters. The number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> and non-right purchases <orig>الشراء غير الأيمن</orig> from among the candidates must be present in each electoral district, and the number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not be less than 15.
    *   a- Register the right purchase <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> papers as a percentage.
    *   b- Register the non-right purchase <orig>الشراء غير الأيمن</orig> papers as a percentage.
*   Candidates: Each candidate assigns only one person from among the candidates. The number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not be less than 15 to 25 of the candidates, and the number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not exceed 100.
*   Voters: Each voter assigns one vote. Votes must be granted that were directed by Decision 1 of Article 25. The right purchase <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must be granted through the ballot, and the non-right purchase <orig>الشراء غير الأيمن</orig> must be granted through the ballot by the voter candidates.
*   Ballot: In the first ballot, the number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must be from the total votes, relative to the number of non-right purchases <orig>الشراء غير الأيمن</orig>. The number of voters must not be less, and the number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not exceed 100% of the total votes cast.
    *   If a sufficient number of purchases <orig>الشراء</orig> are not elected in the first ballot, then the candidates who were not elected are elected in the second ballot. The second election must be for the right purchase <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> or the non-right purchase <orig>الشراء غير الأيمن</orig> from the votes cast for them.
*   Second Ballot: The required number of purchases <orig>الشراء</orig> is not elected in the first ballot. The number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> from among the candidates must be present in each electoral district. The number of votes must not be less, and the number of right purchases <orig>الشراء الأيمن</orig> must not exceed 100.
    *   a- The electoral program may not be based on any of the votes in the second ballot. The number of votes must not be less than 100.

If any non-sworn candidate wishes to monitor the vote counting process, they must submit a written request to the head of the polling committee before the required representation percentage and within a mandatory period of two (2) working days.
Every candidate wishing to attend the vote counting process must adhere to the following:
Not to interfere with the vote counting process carried out by the sworn officials, and to maintain complete silence. Anyone who violates this rule may be expelled from the counting hall by the head of the polling committee.
Not to request a recount of votes already counted by the sworn officials, including invalid votes. In this regard, the head of the polling committee shall total the votes received by each candidate, then total the invalid votes, and announce these totals to those present.
Votes of General Assembly members who have not paid their annual subscriptions shall not be counted. Votes of those removed from the voter list shall not be counted. Votes of those removed in the previous ballot shall not be counted.

9) No proposal from any voter shall be considered unless submitted in writing and recorded in the meeting minutes. This proposal may not be voted upon unless supported by a number of members representing a certain percentage of the actual votes. All invalid votes shall be considered as cast against the proposal.

10) Election of Board Members: Nomination and voting must be respected by those registered for the current year, and nomination and voting must be conducted by the members of the Board of Directors. Each nominated member must be a volunteer, and nomination and voting must take place on the same day.

Sharq Community Association / Jam'iyat Sharq Al-Ahliya <orig>جمعية شرق الأهلية</orig>

<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue No. 1738, Seventy-first Year, 44, Sunday, 13 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 11/5/2025 AD
</header>
  The purpose of the Bank shall be to: (i) foster sustainable economic development, create wealth and improve infrastructure connectivity in Asia by investing in infrastructure and other productive sectors; and (ii) promote regional cooperation and partnership in addressing development challenges by working in close collaboration with other multilateral and bilateral development institutions.
2.  Wherever used in this Agreement, references to "Asia" and "region" shall include the geographical regions and composition classified as Asia and Oceania by the United Nations, except as otherwise decided by the Board of Governors.

### Article 2 Functions

To implement its purpose, the Bank shall have the following functions:
(i) to promote investment in the region of public and private capital for development purposes, in particular for development of infrastructure and other productive sectors;
(ii) to utilize the resources at its disposal for financing such development in the region, including those projects and programs which will contribute most effectively to the harmonious economic growth of the region as a whole and having special regard to the needs of less developed members in the region;
(iii) to encourage private investment in projects, enterprises and activities contributing to economic development in the region, in particular in infrastructure and other productive sectors, and to supplement private investment when private capital is not available on reasonable terms and conditions; and
(iv) to undertake such other activities and provide such other services as may further those functions.

### Article 3 Membership

1.  Membership in the Bank shall be open to members of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development or the Asian Development Bank.
    (a) Regional members shall be those members listed in Part A of Schedule A and other members included in the Asia region in accordance with paragraph 2 of Article 1. All other members shall be non-regional members.

2. Members of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development or the Asian Development Bank which do not become members in accordance with Article 58 may be admitted, under such terms and conditions as the Bank shall determine, to membership in the Bank by a Special Majority vote of the Board of Governors as provided in Article 28.

3. In the case of an applicant which is not sovereign or not responsible for the conduct of its international relations, the application for membership in the Bank shall be presented or agreed by the member of the Bank responsible for its international relations.

## CHAPTER II
## CAPITAL

### Article 4 Authorized Capital

1. The authorized capital stock of the Bank shall be one hundred billion United States dollars ($100,000,000,000), divided into one million (1,000,000) shares having a par value of 100,000 dollars ($100,000) each, which shall be available for subscription only by members in accordance with the provisions of Article 5.

2. The original authorized capital stock shall be divided into paid-in shares and callable shares. Shares having an aggregate par value of twenty billion dollars ($20,000,000,000) shall be paid-in shares, and shares having an aggregate par value of eighty billion dollars ($80,000,000,000) shall be callable.

3. The authorized capital stock of the Bank may be increased by the Board of Governors by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28, at such time and under such terms and conditions as it may deem advisable, including the proportion between paid-in and callable shares.

4. The term "dollar" and the symbol "$" wherever used in this Agreement shall be understood as being the official currency of payment of the United States of America.

### Article 5 Subscription of Shares

1. Each member shall subscribe to shares of the capital stock of the Bank. Each subscription to the original authorized capital stock shall be for paid-in shares and callable shares in the proportion two (2) to eight (8). The initial number of shares available to be subscribed by countries which become members in accordance with Article 58 shall be that set forth in Schedule A

The initial number of shares to be subscribed by countries which are admitted to membership in accordance with paragraph 2 of Article 3 shall be determined by the Board of Governors, provided, however, that no such subscription shall be authorized which would have the effect of reducing the percentage of capital stock held by regional members below seventy-five (75) per cent of the total subscribed capital stock, unless otherwise agreed by the Board of Governors by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.

3. The Board of Governors may, at the request of a member, increase the subscription of such member on such terms and conditions as the Board may determine by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28; provided, however, that no such increase in the subscription of any member shall be authorized which would have the effect of reducing the percentage of capital stock held by regional members below seventy-five (75) per cent of the total subscribed capital stock, unless otherwise agreed by the Board of Governors by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.

4. The Board of Governors shall at intervals of not more than five (5) years review the capital stock of the Bank. In case of an increase in the authorized capital stock, each member shall have a reasonable opportunity to subscribe, under such terms and conditions as the Board of Governors shall determine, to a proportion of the increase of stock equivalent to the proportion which its stock theretofore subscribed bears to the total subscribed capital stock immediately prior to such increase. No member shall be obligated to subscribe to any part of an increase of capital stock.

## Article 6 Payment of Subscriptions

1. Payment of the amount initially subscribed by each Signatory to this Agreement which becomes a member in accordance with Article 58 to the paid-in capital stock of the Bank shall be made in five (5) installments, of twenty (20) per cent each of such amount, except as provided in paragraph 5 of this Article. The first installment shall be paid by each member within thirty (30) days after the date of its entry into force of this Agreement, or on or before the date of deposit on its behalf of its instrument of ratification, acceptance or approval in accordance with paragraph 1 of Article 58, whichever is later. The second installment shall become due one (1) year from the date on which the preceding installment becomes due. The remaining three (3) installments shall become due successively one (1) year from the date on which the preceding installment becomes due.

2. Each installment of the payment of initial subscriptions to the original paid-in capital stock shall be paid in dollars or other convertible currency, except as provided in paragraph 5 of this Article. The Bank may at any time convert such payments into dollars. All rights, including voting rights, acquired in respect of paid-in and associated callable shares for which such payments are due but have not been received shall be suspended until full payment is received by the Bank.

## Article 7 **Terms of Shares**

1. Shares of stock initially subscribed by members shall be issued at par,
Other shares shall be issued at par unless the Board of Governors by a Special
Majority vote as provided in Article 28 decides in special circumstances to issue
them on other terms.
2. Shares of stock shall not be pledged or encumbered in any manner
whatsoever, and they shall be transferable only to the Bank.
3. The liability of the members on shares shall be limited to the unpaid portion
of their issue price.
4. No member shall be liable, by reason of its membership, for obligations of
the Bank.

## Article 8 **Ordinary Resources**

As used in this Agreement, the term "ordinary resources" of the Bank shall
include the following:
(i) authorized capital stock of the Bank, including both paid-in and callable
shares, subscribed pursuant to Article 5;
(ii) funds raised by the Bank by virtue of powers conferred by paragraph 1 of
Article 16, to which the commitment to calls provided for in paragraph 3
of Article 6 is applicable;

# CHAPTER III
## OPERATIONS OF THE BANK
### Article 9 Use of Resources
The resources and facilities of the Bank shall be used exclusively to implement the purpose and functions set forth, respectively, in Articles 1 and 2, and in accordance with sound banking principles.

### Article 10 Ordinary and Special Operations
1. The operations of the Bank shall consist of:
    (i) ordinary operations financed from the ordinary resources of the Bank, referred to in Article 8; and
    (ii) special operations financed from the Special Funds resources referred to in Article 17.

The two types of operations may separately finance elements of the same project or program.

2. The ordinary resources and the Special Funds resources of the Bank shall at all times and in all respects be held, used, committed, invested or otherwise disposed of entirely separately from each other. The financial statements of the Bank shall show the ordinary operations and special operations separately.

3. The ordinary resources of the Bank shall, under no circumstances, be charged with, or used to discharge, losses or liabilities arising out of special operations or other activities for which Special Funds resources were originally used or committed.

4. Expenses appertaining directly to ordinary operations shall be charged to the ordinary resources of the Bank. Expenses appertaining directly to special operations shall be charged to the Special Funds resources. Any other expenses shall be charged as the Bank shall determine.

### Article 11 Recipients and Methods of Operation

1.  (a) The Bank may provide or facilitate financing to any member, or any
    agency, instrumentality or political subdivision thereof, or any entity or enterprise
    operating in the territory of a member, as well as to international or regional
    agencies or entities concerned with economic development of the region.
    (b) The Bank may, in special circumstances, provide assistance to a
    recipient not listed in sub-paragraph (a) above only if the Board of Governors, by
    a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28: (i) shall have determined that
    such assistance is designed to serve the purpose and come within the functions of
    the Bank's membership; and (ii) shall have
    specified the types of assistance under paragraph 2 of this Article that may be
    provided to such recipient.
2.  The Bank may carry out its operations in any of the following ways:
    (i) by making, co-financing or participating in direct loans;
    (ii) by investment of funds in the equity capital of an institution or enterprise;
    (iii) by guaranteeing, whether as primary or secondary obligor, in whole or in
    part, loans for economic development;
    (iv) by deploying Special Funds resources in accordance with the agreements
    determining their use;
    (v) by providing technical assistance in accordance with Article 15; or
    (vi) through other types of financing as may be determined by the Board of
    Governors by a Special Majority vote as provided in Article 28.

### Article 12 Limitations on Ordinary Operations

1.  The total amount outstanding of loans, equity investments, guarantees and
    other types of financing provided by the Bank in its ordinary operations under
    sub-paragraphs 2 (i), (ii), (iii) and (vi) of Article 11 shall not at any time be
    increased, if by such increase the total amount of its unimpaired subscribed
    capital, reserves and retained earnings included in its ordinary resources would
    be exceeded. Notwithstanding the provisions of the preceding sentence, the
    Board of Governors may, by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28,
    determine at any time that, based on the Bank's financial position and financial
    prospects, the limitation under this paragraph may be increased, up to 250% of the
    Bank's unimpaired subscribed capital, reserves and retained earnings included in
    its ordinary resources.
2.  The amount of the Bank's disbursed equity investments shall not at any
    time exceed an amount corresponding to its total unimpaired paid-in subscribed
    capital and general reserves.

# Article 13 Operating Principles

The operations of the Bank shall be conducted in accordance with the principles set out below:

1.  The Bank shall be guided by sound banking principles in its operations.
2.  The operations of the Bank shall provide principally for the financing of specific projects or specific investment programs, for equity investment, and for technical assistance in accordance with Article 15.
3.  The Bank shall not finance any undertaking in the territory of a member if that member objects to such financing.
4.  The Bank shall ensure that each of its operations complies with the Bank's operational and financial policies, including without limitation, policies addressing environmental and social impacts.
5.  In considering an application for financing, the Bank shall pay due regard to the ability of the recipient to obtain financing or facilities elsewhere on terms and conditions that the Bank considers reasonable for the recipient, taking into account all pertinent factors.
6.  In providing or guaranteeing financing, the Bank shall pay due regard to the prospects that the recipient and guarantor, if any, will be in a position to meet their obligations under the financing contract.
7.  In providing or guaranteeing financing, the financial terms, such as rate of interest and other charges and the schedule for repayment of principal shall be such as are, in the opinion of the Bank, appropriate for the financing concerned and the risk to the Bank.
8.  The Bank shall place no restriction upon the procurement of goods and services from any country from the proceeds of any financing undertaken in the ordinary or special operations of the Bank.
9.  The Bank shall take the necessary measures to ensure that the proceeds of any financing provided, guaranteed or participated in by the Bank are used only for the purposes for which the financing was granted and with due attention to considerations of economy and efficiency.
10. The Bank shall pay due regard to the desirability of avoiding a disproportionate amount of its resources being used for the benefit of any member.
11. The Bank shall seek to maintain reasonable diversification in its investments in equity capital. In its equity investments, the Bank shall not assume responsibility for managing any entity or enterprise in which it has an investment and shall not seek a controlling interest in the entity or enterprise concerned, except where necessary to safeguard the investment of the Bank.

### Article 14 Terms and Conditions for Financing

1.  In the case of loans made or participated in or loans guaranteed by the Bank, the contract shall establish, in conformity with the operating principles set forth in Article 13 and subject to the other provisions of this Agreement, the terms and conditions for the loan or the guarantee. In setting such terms and conditions, the Bank shall take fully into account the need to safeguard its income and financial position.
2.  Where the recipient of loans or guarantees of loans is not itself a member, the Bank may, when it deems it advisable, require that the member in whose territory the project concerned is to be carried out, or a public agency or any instrumentality thereof acceptable to the Bank, guarantee the repayment of the principal and the payment of interest and other charges on the loan in accordance with the terms thereof.
3.  The amount of any equity investment shall not exceed such percentage of the equity capital of the entity or enterprise concerned as permitted under policies approved by the Board of Directors.
4.  The Bank may provide financing in its operations in the currency of the country concerned, in accordance with policies that minimize currency risk.

### Article 15 Technical Assistance

1.  The Bank may provide technical advice and assistance and other similar forms of assistance which serve its purpose and come within its functions.
2.  Where expenditures incurred in furnishing such services are not reimbursable, the Bank shall charge such expenditures to the income of the Bank.

### CHAPTER IV
### FINANCES OF THE BANK

### Article 16 General Powers

In addition to the powers specified elsewhere in this Agreement, the Bank shall have the powers set out below:
1.  The Bank may raise funds, through borrowing or other means, in member countries or elsewhere, in accordance with the relevant legal provisions.
2.  The Bank may buy and sell securities the Bank has issued or guaranteed or in which it has invested.
3.  The Bank may guarantee securities in which it has invested in order to facilitate their sale.

6. The Bank shall ensure that every security issued or guaranteed by the Bank shall bear on its face a conspicuous statement to the effect that it is not an obligation of any Government, unless it is in fact the obligation of a particular Government, in which case it shall so state.

9. The Bank may exercise such other powers and establish such rules and regulations as may be necessary or appropriate in furtherance of its purpose and functions, consistent with the provisions of this Agreement.

## Article 17 Special Funds

1. The Bank may accept Special Funds which are designed to serve the purpose and come within the functions of the Bank, such Special Funds shall be resources of the Bank. The full cost of administering any Special Fund shall be charged to that Special Fund.
2. Special Funds accepted by the Bank may be used on terms and conditions consistent with the purpose and functions of the Bank and with the agreement relating to such Funds.
3. The Bank shall adopt such special rules and regulations as may be required for the establishment, administration and use of each Special Fund. Such rules and regulations shall be consistent with the provisions of this Agreement, except for those provisions expressly applicable only to ordinary operations of the Bank.
4. The term "Special Funds resources" shall refer to the resources of any Special Fund and shall include:
    (i) funds accepted by the Bank for inclusion in any Special Fund;

### Article 18 Allocation and Distribution of Net Income

1.  The Board of Governors shall determine at least annually what part of the net income of the Bank shall be allocated, after making provision for reserves, to retained earnings or other purposes and what part, if any, shall be distributed to the members. Any such decision on the allocation of the Bank's net income to other purposes shall be taken by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.
2.  The distribution referred to in the preceding paragraph shall be made in proportion to the number of shares held by each member, and payments shall be made in such manner and in such currency as the Board of Governors shall determine.

### Article 19 Currencies

1.  Members shall not impose any restrictions on currencies, including the receipt, holding, use or transfer by the Bank or by any recipient from the Bank, for payments in any country.
2.  Whenever it shall become necessary under this Agreement to value any currency in terms of another or to determine whether any currency is convertible, such valuation or determination shall be made by the Board.

### Article 20 Methods of Meeting Liabilities of the Bank

1.  In the Bank's ordinary operations, in cases of arrears or default on loans made, participated in, or guaranteed by the Bank, and in cases of losses on equity investment or other types of financing made under sub-paragraph 2 (vi) of Article 11, the Bank shall take such action as it deems appropriate. The Bank shall maintain appropriate provisions against possible losses.
2.  Losses arising in the Bank's ordinary operations shall be charged:
    (i) first, to the provisions referred to in paragraph 1 above;
    (ii) second, to net income;
    (iii) third, against reserves and retained earnings;
    (iv) fourth, against unimpaired paid-in capital; and
    (v) last, against an appropriate amount of the uncalled subscribed callable capital which shall be called in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 3 of Article 6.

# CHAPTER V
## GOVERNANCE

### Article 21 Structure
The Bank shall have a Board of Governors, a Board of Directors, a President, one or more Vice-Presidents, and such other officers and staff as may be considered necessary.

### Article 22 Board of Governors: Composition
1. Each member shall be represented on the Board of Governors and shall appoint one Governor and one Alternate Governor. Each Governor and Alternate Governor shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing member. No Alternate Governor may vote except in the absence of his principal.
2. At each of its annual meetings, the Board shall elect one of the Governors as Chairman who shall hold office until the election of the next Chairman.
3. Governors and Alternate Governors shall serve at such without remuneration from the Bank, but the Bank may pay them reasonable expenses incurred in attending meetings.

### Article 23 Board of Governors: Powers
1. All the powers of the Bank shall be vested in the Board of Governors.
2. The Board of Governors may delegate to the Board of Directors any or all its powers, except the power to:
(i) admit new members and determine the conditions of their admission;
(ii) increase or decrease the authorized capital stock of the Bank;
(iii) suspend a member;
(iv) decide appeals from interpretations or applications of this Agreement given by the Board of Directors;
(v) elect the Directors of the Bank and determine the expenses to be paid for Directors and Alternate Directors and remuneration, if any, pursuant to paragraph 6 of Article 25;
(vi) elect the President, suspend or remove him from office, and determine his remuneration and other conditions of service;
(vii) approve, after reviewing the auditors' report, the general balance sheet and the statement of profit and loss of the Bank;
(viii) determine the reserves and the allocation and distribution of the net profits of the Bank;
(ix) amend this Agreement;(x) decide to terminate the operations of the Bank and to distribute its assets;
and
(xi) exercise such other powers as are expressly assigned to the Board of Governors in this Agreement.

3. The Board of Governors shall retain full power to exercise authority over any matter delegated to the Board of Directors under paragraph 2 of this Article.

Article 24 Board of Governors: Procedure
1. The Board of Governors shall hold an annual meeting and such other meetings as may be provided for by the Board of Governors or called by the Board of Directors. Meetings of the Board of Governors shall be called by the Board of Directors whenever requested by five (5) members of the Bank.
2. A majority of the Governors shall constitute a quorum for any meeting of the Board of Governors, provided such majority represents not less than two-thirds of the total voting power of the members.
3. The Board of Governors shall by regulation establish procedures whereby the Board of Directors may obtain a vote of the Governors on a specific question without a meeting and provide for electronic meetings of the Board of Governors in special circumstances.
4. The Board of Governors, and the Board of Directors to the extent authorized, may establish such subsidiary entities, and adopt such rules and regulations as may be necessary or appropriate to conduct the business of the Bank.

Article 25 Board of Directors: Composition
1. The Board of Directors shall be composed of twelve (12) members who shall not be members of the Board of Governors, and of whom:
(i) nine (9) shall be elected by the Governors representing regional members; and
(ii) three (3) shall be elected by the Governors representing non-regional members.
Directors shall be persons of high competence in economic and financial matters and shall be elected in accordance with Schedule B. Directors shall represent members whose Governors have elected them as well as members whose Governors assign their votes to them.
2. The Board of Governors shall, from time to time, review the size and composition of the Board of Directors, and may increase or decrease the size or revise the composition as appropriate, by a Super Majority vote as provided in Article 28.
