-4 Enhancing market competitiveness by proposing policies that incentivize manufacturers and importers to provide goods in appropriate quantities and at suitable prices.
-5 Combating commercial dumping and protecting national products, based on relevant decisions, especially Decision No. (2024/222) regarding construction materials.
-6 Reviewing reports issued by sub-committees and making appropriate decisions regarding them, while submitting periodic reports to the Minister that include the most important developments and recommendations.

### Article (3)
The Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> may, by a decision issued by it, establish specialized sub-committees as it deems appropriate. These committees may include, but are not limited to, the following:

1.  Price Monitoring Committee <orig>لجنة متابعة الأسعار</orig>:
    *   The committee is responsible for analyzing and monitoring price movements in the markets, and preparing periodic reports on developments and the need for regulatory intervention when necessary.
    *   The committee works to approve price adjustments and review the introduction of new products, while providing appropriate recommendations to ensure market balance.
    *   The committee monitors the impact of price changes to ensure their stability and protect consumers from unjustified fluctuations, taking into account economic and commercial factors.
    *   The committee is responsible for approving price increases for goods. No increase in any of the current market prices is permitted except after a decision is issued by this committee, and any increase made without its approval is considered a violation of the law.

2.  Inflation Rate Monitoring Committee <orig>لجنة متابعة نسب التضخم</orig>:
    *   It specializes in studying local and international inflation factors and analyzing their impact on local markets.
    *   Evaluating economic factors affecting inflation rates and providing recommendations to mitigate their negative effects.
    *   Monitoring global price developments and their impact on import costs and their repercussions on the local market.

3.  Market and Supply Chain Regulation Committee <orig>لجنة تنظيم الأسواق وسلاسل الإمداد</orig>:
    *   Establishing controls and procedures that regulate supply and demand operations in the markets to prevent bottlenecks and achieve balance.

- b- Proposing policies that enhance the efficiency of supply chains and limit any disruptions that may affect the flow of goods and services.
- c- Regularly evaluating the performance of supply chains and monitoring challenges that may hinder the smooth flow of supply.
- d- Coordinating with relevant authorities to provide necessary solutions to maintain the continuous flow of goods and services without delay.
- e- Submitting recommendations for developing logistical infrastructure and improving storage and distribution mechanisms to support market stability.
- f- Monitoring the compliance of suppliers and traders with regulations governing markets and supply chains, and taking corrective actions when necessary.

### 4. Strategic Stock Monitoring Committee:
- a- The committee monitors the level of strategic stock of essential goods to ensure their sustainable availability and meet consumer needs.
- b- It develops plans and procedures to enhance the strategic stock, including determining optimal storage levels for essential goods, and submits its recommendations to the Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> for approval.
- c- It coordinates with relevant authorities to ensure the continuity of food and consumer supplies during crises and emergencies.
- d- It monitors changes in demand for essential goods and provides proposals to address any potential shortages in the markets.
- e- The committee prepares periodic reports on the status of the strategic stock, in addition to recommendations for maintaining its stability.

### Article (4)
#### Monitoring of Sub-Committees
The Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> is responsible for monitoring the recommendations of the sub-committees. It may add new competencies in line with work requirements and developments. The committee also has the right to establish new committees when needed, after obtaining the Minister's <orig>الوزير</orig> approval, to enhance the efficiency of policy and procedure implementation.

### Article (5)
#### Sub-Committee Reports
Each sub-committee shall submit periodic reports to the Central Committee <orig>اللجنة المركزية</orig> according to its specified mandate, to present recommendations or decisions for endorsement or review.

## Article (6)
Committee Secretariat
The Minister shall issue a decision to form a team for the secretariat of the Central Committee and its sub-committees, which shall undertake the following tasks:
1. Recording the minutes of meetings held by the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
2. Liaising with relevant authorities and monitoring the implementation of decisions issued by the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
3. Submitting periodic reports (once every three months) to the Minister, including the most important works and decisions of the Central Committee and its sub-committees.
4. Any other tasks assigned to the team by a decision of the Minister who formed it.

## Article (7)
Grievance Committee
The Minister shall issue a decision to form a grievance committee specialized in examining grievances submitted against executive decisions issued by the Central Committee or its sub-committees.

## Article (8)
Financial Remunerations
No financial remunerations shall be allocated to the members of the Central Committee or its sub-committees for their participation in its work.

## Article (9)
Decisions No. (62), (67), (75), (79), (96), and (97) for the year 2020 are hereby repealed, as well as any provisions that contradict this Decision.

## Article (10)
This Decision shall be implemented from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette. Concerned authorities shall be obligated to implement its provisions, each within its scope of jurisdiction.
Minister of Commerce and Industry
**Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajil <orig>خليفه عبد الله العجيل</orig>**

<header>
266
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue No. 1738, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 13 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH / May 11, 2025 AD
</header>

It is hereby decided

Article One
Conditions for Transfer to Work in Emergency Teams (Shifts):
1. The employee must have spent at least two years in the Commercial Control Department <orig>إدارة الرقابة التجارية</orig> centers as a commercial inspector or assistant inspector.
2. Must have obtained an excellent performance appraisal in the last year of their service.
3. Must not have been subject to any disciplinary action.
4. The number of reports and complaints issued by them must not be less than 100 reports/complaints during the last year of their service.
5. Must successfully complete a one-month refresher course in the field of work of the Commercial Control Department <orig>إدارة الرقابة التجارية</orig>.

Article Two
Work System for Emergency Teams:
1. Duration of Work: The employee shall work in emergency teams for a period of one year, renewable based on their performance statistics and the report of their assigned emergency head. Renewal shall be approved by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> or their authorized representative.
2. Team Formation: Emergency teams in the governorates shall be divided into three shifts (A – B – C). Each shift shall have a supervisor, and each team shall have a head.
3. Team Division by Governorates:
    • Emergency team for the Governorates of Al-Asimah <orig>العاصمة</orig> and Hawalli <orig>حولي</orig>.
    • Emergency team for the Governorates of Al-Jahra <orig>الجهراء</orig> and Al-Farwaniyah <orig>الفروانية</orig>.
    • Emergency team for the Governorates of Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> and Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig>.
4. Fish Market (Sharq): An emergency team shall be assigned to it with the same formation as stated in item (2).
5. Scope of Work: Each team shall operate within the scope of its assigned governorate, whether in inspection or receiving complaints. The Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig> or their authorized representative may assign a team or a shift specific tasks outside this scope.
6. Administrative Affiliation: Emergency teams shall report to the Undersecretary of the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig>.
7. Periodic Reports: Each head of an emergency team shall submit a report every three months to the Undersecretary of the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig>, including inspection tours, violation reports, and completed complaints.
8. Rotation: The Undersecretary of the Control and Consumer Protection Sector <orig>قطاع الرقابة وحماية المستهلك</orig> has the right, in accordance with the interest of work, to conduct rotation among emergency teams (head, supervisor, employee).

Article Three
Decision No. 410 of 2019, referred to herein, is hereby repealed, as is any text that contradicts the provisions of this Decision.

Article Four
Officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decision. Any text that contradicts its provisions is hereby repealed. This Decision shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبدالله العجيل</orig>

## Ministerial Decision No. (93) of 2025
### Regarding the Determination of the Regulation of Prices for Medicines and Pharmaceutical Preparations in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>

The Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>:
- Having reviewed the provisions of the Decree-Law on the Civil Service System <orig>المرسوم بقانون نظام الخدمة المدنية</orig> and its amendments,
- And the provisions of Law No. 28 of 1996 regarding the Regulation of the Pharmacy Profession and Circulation of Medicines <orig>القانون رقم 28 لسنة 1996 في شأن تنظيم مهنة الصيدلة وتداول الأدوية</orig>, and Article No. 13 of the aforementioned Law,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 238 of 1992 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 238 لسنة 1992</orig> regarding the determination of prices for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 232 of 2015 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 232 لسنة 2015</orig> concerning the study and stabilization of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 16 of 2021 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 16 لسنة 2021</orig> concerning the adoption of the pricing mechanism for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 58 of 2023 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 58 لسنة 2023</orig> concerning the pricing of medicines, pharmaceutical preparations, and nutritional supplements in the private sector,
- And Ministerial Decision No. 74 of 2023 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 74 لسنة 2023</orig> concerning the determination of prices for medicines and pharmaceutical preparations,
- And Administrative Decision No. 8367 of 2022 <orig>القرار الإداري رقم 8367 لسنة 2022</orig> concerning the stabilization of foreign currency exchange rates against the Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>الدينار الكويتي</orig> exchange rate,
- And based on the recommendation of the Drug Pricing Committee <orig>لجنة تسعير الأدوية</orig> formed by Ministerial Decision No. 117 of 2018 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 117 لسنة 2018</orig>, convened on April 28, 2025,
- And based on the requirements of public interest, and what was presented to us by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>.
- Has decided -

### Article One
The prices of medicines and pharmaceutical preparations in the attached price list, totaling 69 items, starting with the medicine 5%w/v Dextrose & 0.225%w/v Sodium Chloride IV Injection USP (250ml Bag) and ending with Zarzio 48 MU/0.5ml Solution for Injection or Infusion in Pre-filled Syringe, are hereby approved and added to Ministerial Decision No. 74 of 2023 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 74 لسنة 2023</orig>.

### Article Two
This Decision shall be communicated to those concerned for its implementation, and any decision or text conflicting with it shall be revoked. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Health <orig>وزير الصحة</orig>
Dr. Ahmed Abdulwahab Al-Awadhi <orig>د. أحمد عبد الوهاب العوضي</orig>

## Decision No. (82) of 2025
Regarding
The License Application Submitted by Kuwait International Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية</orig>
for Custody to Practice Securities Activities

After reviewing:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And Decision No. (31) of 2016 issued on 2016/04/13 regarding the preliminary approval for the establishment of a Kuwaiti closed shareholding company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> to practice securities activities in accordance with Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its amendments;
- And Item No. 22 of Annex No. (3) Transitional Provisions of Decision No. 72 of 2015 issued on 2015/11/9 regarding the issuance of the Executive Regulations for Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its amendments;
- And the application for licensing securities activities submitted by Kuwait International Custody Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية لأمانة الحفظ</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig> issued on 2025/01/12.

It was decided as follows:
### Article One:
Kuwait International Custody Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية لأمانة الحفظ</orig> is licensed to practice the following activities:
1. Custodian.
2. Investment Controller.

### Article Two:
The license period for the aforementioned company shall be three years, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate, and after payment of the prescribed fee.
The aforementioned company is obligated to pay the prescribed fee upon renewal of the license for any other period in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 7 of 2010, its Executive Regulations, their amendments, and the decisions and instructions of the Authority.

### Article Three:
Kuwait International Company for Custody <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية للأمانة</orig> must complete the transfer of all operations related to the custodian activity and investment controller activity to Kuwait International Custody Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية لأمانة الحفظ</orig>, and the resulting procedures, within a maximum period of six months from the date of issuance of this decision.

### Article Four:
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

<footer>
Head of Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

# Resolution No. (83) of 2025
## Regarding
**Application for License Submitted by Al-Dawli Invest Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to Practice Securities Activities**

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- Resolution No. (147) of 2024 regarding the application for a license submitted by Al-Dawli Invest Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to practice securities activities in accordance with Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its amendments, issued on 31/10/2024;
- And based on the request of Al-Dawli Invest Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> to renew the preliminary approval issued by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> for a similar period;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has resolved the following:
### Article One:
The preliminary approval granted to Al-Dawli Invest Company <orig>شركة الدولي إنفست للاستثمار</orig> for licensing the activity of a securities broker not registered on the stock exchange shall be renewed.
This approval shall be valid for a period of six months, commencing from 01/05/2025 and ending on 01/11/2025, for the purpose of fulfilling the criteria specified by the Authority.

### Article Two:
The company mentioned in this resolution shall be licensed, after completing the requirements referred to in the preliminary approval letter issued by the Authority, for a period of three years renewable from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate, and after payment of the prescribed fee.

### Article Three:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

# Resolution No. (84) of 2025
## Regarding
**Renewal of the Registration of Mr. Bader Adel Salem Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل سالم العبدالجادر</orig> in the Special Register for Auditors**

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the Auditor Registration Certificate of Mr. Bader Adel Salem Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل سالم العبدالجادر</orig> No. (EA/2013/0002) issued on 10/05/2022;
- And the request of Mr. Bader Adel Salem Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل سالم العبدالجادر</orig> to renew his registration as an auditor in the Special Register with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has resolved the following:
### Article One:
The registration of the auditor Mr. Bader Adel Salem Al-Abduljader <orig>بدر عادل سالم العبدالجادر</orig> in the Special Register for Auditors with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 10/05/2025.

### Article Two:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette.

## Resolution No. (86) of 2025
Regarding
### License Application Submitted by Wazen Integrated Computer Solutions Company <orig>شركة وازن للحلول الحاسوبية المتكاملة</orig> to Practice Securities Activities
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and its Executive Regulations and their amendments;
- The application for a license for securities activities submitted by Wazen Integrated Computer Solutions Company <orig>شركة وازن للحلول الحاسوبية المتكاملة</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 12/01/2025.
It has been resolved as follows:
### Article One
The Authority grants preliminary approval to Wazen Integrated Computer Solutions Company <orig>شركة وازن للحلول الحاسوبية المتكاملة</orig> for licensing the activity of an investment advisor.
This approval is valid for a period of six months, renewable, commencing from 06/05/2025 and ending on 05/11/2025, for the purpose of fulfilling the criteria specified by the Authority.
### Article Two
The company mentioned in this Resolution shall be licensed, after completing the requirements referred to in the preliminary approval letter issued by the Authority, for a period of three years, renewable, from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fee.
### Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this Resolution, each within its respective jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

# Decision No. (88) of 2025
## Regarding the Collective Investment Scheme License Granted to Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> for Establishing the Pearl US Dollar Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدولار الأمريكي</orig> in Accordance with Sharia Principles

**After reviewing:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The request from Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to establish the Pearl US Dollar Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدولار الأمريكي</orig> in accordance with Sharia principles in the State of Kuwait;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- The Articles of Association, Prospectus, and Service Provider Agreements for the Pearl US Dollar Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدولار الأمريكي</orig> in accordance with Sharia principles;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Decided the following:**
## Article One:
Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is granted approval to establish the Pearl US Dollar Money Market Fund <orig>صندوق اللؤلؤة للسوق النقدي بالدولار الأمريكي</orig> in accordance with Sharia principles. It shall be offered for public subscription with variable capital, ranging between a minimum of USD 7,000,000 (seven million US Dollars only) and a maximum of USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), with a nominal value of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only) per unit. Unit holders may not subscribe/participate in the Fund for the first time with less than USD 3,000 (three thousand US Dollars only) and multiples of USD 10 (ten US Dollars only).

## Article Two:
100,000,000 units (one hundred million units only), equivalent to USD 1,000,000,000 (one billion US Dollars only), shall be offered for subscription. The Fund Manager's participation in the Fund's units at establishment must not be less than KWD 100,000 (one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only) or its equivalent in other currencies as a minimum. The Fund Manager may dispose of or redeem some of the units owned by them if their net value exceeds the minimum limit stipulated in this Article.

The entities receiving subscription applications are:
- Gulf Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة الخليج كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>
- Gulf Bank <orig>بنك الخليج</orig>

# Decision No. (87) of 2025
## Regarding the Cancellation of Registration of Mr. Waleed Abdullah Saud Al-Osaimi <orig>وليد عبدالله سعود العصيمي</orig> from the Special Register of Auditors

**After reviewing:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Auditor Registration Certificate of Mr. Waleed Abdullah Saud Al-Osaimi <orig>وليد عبدالله سعود العصيمي</orig> No. (EA/2013/0027) issued on 10/05/2022;
- The request from Mr. Waleed Abdullah Saud Al-Osaimi <orig>وليد عبدالله سعود العصيمي</orig> to cancel his registration from the Special Register of Auditors with the Authority;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Decided the following:**
## Article One:
The registration of Mr. Waleed Abdullah Saud Al-Osaimi <orig>وليد عبدالله سعود العصيمي</orig> from the Special Register of Auditors with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> is hereby cancelled.

## Article Two:
Mr. Waleed Abdullah Saud Al-Osaimi <orig>وليد عبدالله سعود العصيمي</orig> shall fulfill all legal obligations stipulated by Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments, for the period prior to the enforcement of this Decision.

## Article Three:
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziyad Yaqoub Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب الفليج</orig>

Issued on: May 7, 2025 AD
### Article Three:
The Fund's objectives based on what is stated in the Prospectus.

### Article Four:
The term of the Fund is fifteen years, commencing from the date of its registration in the Register of Funds at the Authority. It is renewable for another similar term upon the request of the Fund Manager and after obtaining the approval of the Authority and the unitholders who represent more than 50% of the Fund's issued capital.
### Article Five:
The Fund shall be granted a temporary license for a period of three months from the start date of the subscription, for the purpose of completing the Authority's requirements and the Fund's minimum capital. It is not permissible to practice any of the Fund's activities based on this temporary license.
### Article Six:
The applicant may close the subscription period and be satisfied with the subscribed capital at any time during the temporary license period, provided that the targeted group invited to subscribe is announced or notified no less than three business days before the new closing date.
### Article Seven:
In the event the temporary license period expires without completing the requirements stipulated in Article Five of this decision, the temporary license shall be forfeited, unless the license's validity is extended for another similar period upon the request of the license applicant before the end of the original temporary license period.
### Article Eight:
The prescribed fees shall be paid within thirty days from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.
### Article Nine:
The Fund shall be licensed for a period of three years from the date of its registration in the Register of Funds at the Authority, after it has completed the minimum capital requirement.
### Article Ten:
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Issued on: May 7, 2025

# Decision No. (89) of 2025
## Regarding the refusal to renew the securities activities license for Al-Masaleh Investment Company with the Authority
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments;
- And the securities activities license certificate for Al-Masaleh Investment Company <orig>شركة المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> No. (AP/2016/0014) issued on 19/04/2022;
- And upon the request of Al-Masaleh Investment Company <orig>شركة المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the amendment of the final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.
The following has been decided:
### Article One:
To refuse the renewal of the securities activities license for Al-Masaleh Investment Company <orig>شركة المصالح الاستثمارية</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of Investment Portfolio Manager, as the company does not possess the required capability and competence to practice the securities activities subject to the license.
### Article Two:
The company shall be obligated to deliver the clients' funds and assets to them or to whoever is concerned with holding, managing, or safekeeping them, within one year from the date of issuance of this decision.
### Article Three:
The company shall be obligated to provide the Authority with a monthly report, starting from the date of issuance of this decision, on the termination of the company's business related to clients' funds and assets, until it completes the handover procedures.
### Article Four:
The company shall fulfill all legal obligations stipulated under Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, and its executive regulations and their amendments, for the period preceding the effective date of this decision.
### Article Five:
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from 18/04/2025 and shall be published in the Official Gazette.
Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Flaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

Issued on: May 8, 2025
</footer>

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of public practice No. (D.A/M/804) for the maintenance of Microsoft DYNAMICS systems. Those wishing to participate from specialized companies or establishments in this field should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and practice documents during official working hours from the (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of the announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (75/- K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only (K-Net payment only) for the booklet, starting from Sunday, 2025/5/11, from 8:30 AM until 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 2025/5/22. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage and a valid tax compliance certificate.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID of the company's representative to purchase the practice document.
6- This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
The preliminary meeting date is Monday, 2025/5/19, at 10:00 AM. The bid must remain valid for (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

Secretary General of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>

## Announcement of Tender No. WKM / 19/2024/2025

Selection of a consultant for the project of supplying, installing, operating, and maintaining combined cycle gas turbine units (3600) MW at Al-Nuwaiseeb <orig>النويصيب</orig> site, Phase One.
Upon the request of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>.
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Gas Turbine Project</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission Date | Deadline for Bid Submission (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|:------|:---|:------|:--------|
| 2025-05-11 | 2025-08-12 | 1000 | 62,000 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> valid for 90 days in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

Preliminary Meeting
10:00 AM on Wednesday, 11-06-2025, at the Ministry's <orig>الوزارة</orig> main building – 3rd Floor – Power Stations Projects Meeting Room.

## Announcement of Tender No. WKM / 72/2024/2025

Works for extending and welding 11 kV medium voltage underground cables for the expansion of the electrical distribution network in Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> and Mubarak Al-Kabeer <orig>مبارك الكبير</orig> Governorates.
Upon the request of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>.
Tender documents can be obtained from the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Medium Voltage Cable Extension Project</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission Date | Deadline for Bid Submission (Closing Date) | Price | Guarantee |
|:------|:---|:------|:--------|
| 2025-05-11 | 2025-06-15 | 1000 | 45,000 KWD <orig>د.ك</orig> valid for 90 days in favor of the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> |
</table>

Preliminary Meeting
(Inquiries Session)
10:00 AM on Sunday, 25-05-2025, at the Planning and Follow-up Department building in the Networks Sector.

Tender documents will be published on the Agency's <orig>الجهاز</orig> website for review before proceeding to purchase the documents.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for bid submission.
- Bidders and practitioners must adhere to the instructions regarding the submission and deposit of bids on the CD available on the Agency's <orig>الجهاز</orig> website WWW.CAPT.GOV.KW.
- The cash equivalent mentioned above shall be paid by certified check or K-Net card.
- Companies / bidders wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications, etc., must adhere to submitting them to the concerned party at the time and place specified above in the schedule for the preliminary meeting (inquiries session), and no inquiries or clarifications submitted to the Agency <orig>الجهاز</orig> will be considered.
- All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, except for the bid form and initial security, which must be submitted as hard copies.
- Indivisible.
- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid.
- The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the bidder's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector, noting that bids not including this certificate will be excluded.
- This announcement serves as an invitation for interested bidders to attend, as interested companies have the right to attend the bid opening session.
- Interested companies wishing to attend must coordinate with the Bid Opening Department before the specified date for the bid opening session and bring the following documents:
1. Copy of the Civil ID.
2. Copy of the signature authorization for the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
3. In case of attendance by a person other than the authorized signatory, a written letter from the authorized signatory at the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> must be presented, authorizing whomever they deem fit to attend the session.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
- Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the tender must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.

Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Sunday, April 20, 2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of National Investment Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار ش.م.ك.م.</orig> held its meeting at 11:00 AM on Sunday, April 20, 2025, at the main building of National Bank of Kuwait K.S.C.P. <orig>بنك الكويت الوطني ش.م.ك.ع</orig>, located in Kuwait City <orig>مدينة الكويت</orig> – Sharq – Al-Shuhada and Jaber Al-Mubarak Street – 35th Floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Faisal Abdul Latif Yousef Al-Hamad <orig>فيصل عبد اللطيف يوسف الحمد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. Shareholders representing – in person and by proxy – 156,200,000 shares, constituting 100% of the Company's total shares, attended the meeting. The secretariat of the meeting was handled by Ms. Rasha Abdul Rahman Ibrahim <orig>رشا عبد الرحمن إبراهيم</orig> – Board Secretary.
After Mr. Faisal Abdul Latif Yousef Al-Hamad <orig>فيصل عبد اللطيف يوسف الحمد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors – announced the availability of the legal quorum for the Extraordinary General Assembly, he opened the meeting by welcoming the esteemed shareholders and thanking them for attending. The Extraordinary General Assembly then proceeded to discuss the items on its agenda and resolved the following:
1- Ratification of the draft merger agreement by absorption between National Investment Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار ش.م.ك. (مقفلة)</orig> ("National Investment") and National Financial Brokerage Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية ش.م.ك. (مقفلة)</orig> ("National Brokerage"), whereby National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> shall be the acquiring company and National Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية</orig> shall be the acquired company, and all its annexes, including the independent investment advisor's consultation, the asset valuation report prepared by the independent asset valuer, and the share exchange ratio, after obtaining the approvals of the relevant regulatory authorities.
2- Approval of the merger by absorption between National Investment Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار ش.م.ك. (مقفلة)</orig> ("National Investment") and National Financial Brokerage Company K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية ش.م.ك. (مقفلة)</orig> ("National Brokerage"), whereby National Investment Company <orig>شركة الوطني للاستثمار</orig> shall be the acquiring company and National Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية</orig> shall be the acquired company, through the dissolution of National Financial Brokerage Company <orig>شركة الوطني للوساطة المالية</orig>, in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (7) of 2010 and its executive regulations, and their amendments, after obtaining the approvals of the relevant regulatory authorities.
3- Approval of an in-kind increase in the Company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital by the net asset value of the acquired company from KWD 15,620,000 (fifteen million, six hundred and twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to KWD 16,511,786.500 (sixteen million, five hundred and eleven thousand, seven hundred and eighty-six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and five hundred fils), distributed over 165,117,865 (one hundred and sixty-five million, one hundred and seventeen thousand, eight hundred and sixty-five shares), with an in-kind increase of KWD 891,786.500 (eight hundred and ninety-one thousand, seven hundred and eighty-six Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and five hundred fils), equivalent to 5.709261% of the total current issued and paid-up capital, by issuing 8,917,865 new shares (eight million, nine hundred and seventeen thousand, eight hundred and sixty-five shares) at a par value of 100 fils per share, plus KWD 1.79282973 as a share premium, with the current shareholders of the acquiring company waiving their pre-emptive right to subscribe to the increased shares, provided that all shares of the acquiring company's capital increase are allocated to the shareholders of the acquired company at a share exchange ratio of 0.1783573 of the acquiring company's shares for every one share of

(K.S.C.C.) Closed
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Thiqa Food Group Company <orig>مجموعة الثقة الغذائية</orig> (K.S.C.C.) Closed held its meeting at 11:00 AM on Thursday, 2025/3/27, in Hawally area <orig>منطقة حولي</orig> - Beirut Street <orig>شارع بيروت</orig> - Al-Safat Tower <orig>برج الصفاة</orig> - 9th Floor.
With the attendance of those owning 20,000,000 shares (twenty million shares), representing 100% of the attendance. At the beginning of the meeting, Mr. / Representative of Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig> announced the completion of the legal quorum. Mr. / Chairman of the Board of Directors opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. The meeting proceeded to discuss the agenda, and the following was approved: -
*   Addition of a new purpose to the company's objectives, according to Article (6) of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Company's Bylaws <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, as follows: -
*   Text before amendment: - The purposes for which the company was established are: -
1- Management and operation of all food catering services in restaurants, hospitals, schools, universities, companies, factories, camps, parks, commercial and residential complexes, clubs, institutes, amusement parks, guesthouses, residences, theaters, cinemas, recreational, sports, and tourism projects, and parties, at various grades and levels, including all necessary services, whether directly or indirectly, or performing them on behalf of others.
2- Manufacturing, importing, selling, packaging, storing, and distributing food, beverages, and other consumer goods in a manner the company deems appropriate, wholesale or retail.
3- Purchasing and importing necessary devices, supplies, and equipment for the implementation of the company's objectives.
4- Representing companies and participating in tenders similar to these objectives.
5- Owning movable and immovable properties necessary for its activity within the limits permitted by law.
6- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities. The company may directly conduct the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or an agent. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated objectives.
7- Buying and selling shares and bonds solely for the company's benefit.
Text after amendment: The purposes for which the company was established are: -
1- Buying and selling shares and bonds for the company's account - Activity Code 649917
2- Retail sale of food products - Activity Code 472193.
3- Food catering - Activity Code 562100.
4- Food catering management - Activity Code 562912.
5- Food packaging and wrapping services - Activity Code 829205.
6- Restaurant - Activity Code 561010.
7- Restaurant management - Activity Code 562911.
8- Snacks - Activity Code 561034.
9- Providing hot and cold ready meals - Activity Code 561094.
10- Cafe - Activity Code 563010.
11- Manufacturing ready meals and dishes - Activity Code 107500
12- Wholesale of food and beverages - Activity Code 463000
13- Providing healthy meals - Activity Code 562110.
14- Providing beverages (coffee shop) - Activity Code 563011.
15- Hot and cold beverages - Activity Code 563015.
16- Owning real estate and movable property for the company's benefit - Activity Code 681091.
17- Refrigerated and frozen goods stores (cold storage warehouses) - Activity Code 521021
18- Cafeteria - Activity Code 561020.
19- Fast food restaurants - Activity Code 561031.
20- Pizza restaurants - Activity Code 561032.
21- Ice cream shops - Activity Code 563014.
22- Refreshments - Activity Code 563020.
23- Investing financial surpluses in financial portfolios by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities - Activity Code 649918.
24- Buying and selling land and real estate solely for the company's account - Activity Code 681011.
In conclusion, Mr. / Chairman of the Board of Directors thanked the attendees, wishing the company continued success.
The meeting concluded at 11:45 AM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

Automak Automotive Company <orig>شركة أوتوماك للسيارات</orig> (K.S.C.C.)
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Automak Automotive Company <orig>شركة أوتوماك للسيارات</orig> - a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company Closed - held its meeting at 12:00 PM on Thursday, 2025/05/01, at the company's headquarters.
The meeting session was chaired by Mr. Yousef Abdullah Rashid Al-Bahran Al-Roumi <orig>يوسف عبد الله راشد البحران الرومي</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors.
Also present at the meeting were:
- Shareholders (in person and by proxy) holding 500,181,275 shares attended the meeting room, representing 100% of the company's total capital of 18,127,550 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>.

# Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>
## Announcement
The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. (1662720) specific to the Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>. Tender documents can be obtained from the Military Installations Engineering Department <orig>هندسة المنشآت العسكرية</orig> (Tenders Control – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>).

<table_caption>Tender Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Issuance | Closing | Price | Initial Guarantee |
|:------|:-------|:------|:---|
| 2025-05-11 | 2025-06-24 | 300 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> | 6000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> valid for 90 days |
</table>

**Site Visit**
At 9:00 AM on Tuesday, 2025/05/20, at the headquarters of the Military Installations Engineering Department <orig>هندسة المنشآت العسكرية</orig> – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>.

**Preliminary Meeting**
At 10:00 AM on Wednesday, 2025/05/21, at the headquarters of the Military Installations Engineering Department <orig>هندسة المنشآت العسكرية</orig> – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>.

**Instructions**
1- The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> must be notified of the names, job titles, and passport copies of candidates attending the site visit seven days prior to the date. Only fax submissions will be accepted.
2- The tender purchase receipt must be presented when attending the site visit and preliminary meeting.
3- An authorization letter for purchasing tender documents.
4- A certificate of national labor percentage must be submitted with the bid.
5- The last deadline for purchasing tender documents is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 2025-06-15.
6- The last deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM at the Ministry's Mail and Tenders Delivery Center (Plumber No. 1 – Box No. 1 – Committee for Military Material Procurement and Military Installations Contracts for the Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>), next to Gate No. 12, beside the Military Sports Federation <orig>الاتحاد العسكري الرياضي</orig>.
7- This tender is open to companies specialized in infrastructure study, design, and supervision works, which meet all conditions stipulated in the tender documents and are registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>. Bids are to be submitted under the two-envelope system.

And the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and then purchasing the practice documents. Note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Monday, 2025/6/2, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Envelope Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No. (2025-2024/11) for repair, maintenance, operation, and installation works of materials and equipment at air conditioning (chiller) stations and related works for various departments within the Ministry, for the General Department of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig> – Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Review the General Department of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (in Ardiya Industrial Area <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this tender for a fee of (1,000) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) (via K-Net) (non-refundable), and submit an initial guarantee valid for (90) days in the amount of (20,000) K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only). Note that the final tender security is (10%) of the total contract value. Applicants must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) or the announcement issued on the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> website, and the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and then purchasing the tender documents. Note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Monday, 2025/06/16, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Envelope Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

# Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> in its Session
Held on 2025/04/15
After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in the births and deaths registers, if the Committee <orig>اللجنة</orig> does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the registers, and birth or death certificates will be issued accordingly.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>
Held on 2025/04/15
The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/1969 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.
- Mr. / Director of the Central Registry of Births and Deaths <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig>, Chairman
- Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>قسم القيد</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig>, Member
- Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig>, Member
Ms. Shukriya Al-Duraie <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig> performed the duties of the Committee's <orig>اللجنة</orig> secretary.
The Committee <orig>اللجنة</orig> reviewed requests from No. (156) to No. (170) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death registers for dropped birth and death registration requests. After its review and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the Committee <orig>اللجنة</orig> decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues, so that if the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement expires and no objection is submitted, the amendments will be carried out.
<page_end>349</page_end>

Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> – Drug Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

| No. | Practice No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:----|:---|:------|:-------|:---|
| 1   | 4ON243       | Pills for treating cancer patients, required by Hussein Makki Juma Center <orig>مركز حسين مكي جمعة</orig> for Specialized Surgeries | 1000   | 20 days from the date of announcement and more |
| 2   | 4ON249       | Injections for treating cancer patients, required by Kuwait Cancer Control Center <orig>مركز الكويت لمكافحة السرطان</orig> | 300    | 20 days from the date of announcement and more |

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1- The local company must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2- The local company must specialize in the medical field and be documented with an accredited certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Registration and Drug Control Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية</orig> and the data, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and material's registration in the suppliers' register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to Drug Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>).
5- Submission of samples for new materials, whether a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for specialized control (medicines – medical supplies).
6- Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>

## Announcement of Public Auction for Car Sales

The General Department of Execution <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig> announces that on Sunday, 11/5/2025, and the following three days, starting from 8:00 AM, the following cars will be sold by public auction at the Sales Seizure Garage <orig>كراج حجز البيوع</orig>, in execution of several judgments. Please note that the sale procedures will take place at the Sales Center <orig>مركز البيوع</orig> – Al-Ardiya Al-Hirafiya <orig>العارضية الحرفية</orig>.
Note: - Payment of the full amount via K-Net <orig>الكي نت</orig> on the same day.

Sale on Sunday, 11/5/2025
Please note that vehicle inspection is reserved at Al-Dawha <orig>الدوحة</orig> on Thursday and Saturday from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM, and the sale will take place at the Sales Center <orig>مركز البيوع</orig> in Al-Ardiya Al-Hirafiya <orig>العارضية الحرفية</orig> at 10:00 AM.

## Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transferring and registering ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Property Description:
The entire property of Document No. 2014/601, for which ownership document No. 2021/2301 was issued, located in Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area - Plot No. 218 - Block No. 5 - Plan M/33966 - with an area of 800 m². This will be offered in a public auction with a basic price of 1,895,400 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig> (one million, eight hundred ninety-five thousand, and four hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** As per the description certificate.
The property was found to be an investment residence consisting of a shop + ground floor + 15 repeated floors + roof. The owner has committed several violations.
Construction of an unauthorized external fence obstructing car entry + change of swimming pool location leading to the cancellation of parking spaces from number 86. Unlicensed construction on the ground floor with an area of 35 m².
Violation of incorporating all light wells on repeated floors with a total area of 69 m².
Unauthorized expansion and construction on all repeated floors with an area of 580 m².
** As per the expert's report
The property subject to the dispute, located in Al-Mahboula <orig>المهبولة</orig> area, Block (2) currently, Main Street No. 20 and Inner Street No. 226, Plot 218, where the inspection was carried out as follows:
The property subject to the dispute is a building overlooking a main street, an inner street, and a side alley, with its facades clad and finished, and an area of 800 square meters.
The disputed property consists of the following:
Ground Floor: Reception hall, health club, guard room, swimming pool in the courtyard, and a shop overlooking the main street (grocery store).
First Floor to Fifteenth Floor: Each consists of two apartments. The first apartment consists of a living room, two bedrooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, and a balcony. The second apartment consists of a living room, two bedrooms, three bathrooms, a kitchen, a maid's room with a bathroom, and a balcony.
Sixteenth Floor: Consists of two bedrooms, two bathrooms, two kitchens, and a roof.
The air conditioning for the disputed property is central. There are two elevators in the property, and the apartments are furnished and not independent.

Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those proceeding with the sale procedures are requested to do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Notice:
1- This announcement of sale shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "if the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draw up a lease agreement in their favor at the market rent."

** And according to the expert's report
The session began on 18/9/2022. We proceeded to the Al-Rumaithiya area, Block (2), Abd Al-Hassan Majid Al-Musailim Street, Avenue (1), Building (21), Plot (12), Document No. (282/2004), where one of the properties subject to the lawsuit is located. This was done in the presence and under the guidance of the first appellant's agent, Mr. Abd Al-Amir Alaiwi Shawardi <orig>عبد الأمير عليوي شاوردي</orig>. The remaining litigants were absent despite being notified of the session's date. We were accompanied by the expertise expert, Mr. Adel Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل العسلاوي</orig>. The inspection was conducted as follows:
The property subject to the lawsuit is an old investment building with an area of 750 square meters according to the document. The property overlooks two streets, one of which is a main street named Abd Al-Hassan Al-Musailim Street, and the other is numbered (1). The exterior cladding of the property is stone, and the air conditioning system is "window" type. The property also has an electric elevator and consists of a ground floor and five identical, repeated floors, which are as follows:
The ground floor consists of three identical apartments, each comprising two rooms, a living room, a kitchen, and a bathroom. There is an annex consisting of a room and a private bathroom for the building's guard. There is another room within the annexes, as well as a commercial shop named "Felfel Lomi <orig>فلفل لومي</orig>".
The five identical, repeated floors each consist of four apartments. Each apartment is composed of two rooms, a living room, a kitchen, and a bathroom.
All units in the building are leased except for one apartment on the fifth floor.
The expertise expert took all necessary notes and reviewed the case file to submit the report for the valuation of the aforementioned property.

## Description of the Fourth Property:
5- Property under Document No. 7533/1997, located in the Al-Ardiya area, Block (2), Street (6), Plot (88), House (11), Document No. (7533/1997), with an area of 750 m², to be sold at public auction with a base price of KWD 540,000 (five hundred and forty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** The following was stated in the description certificate and observations:
1- New structures have been added on the roof.

** And according to the expert's report
(1) The session began on 18/9/2022. We proceeded to the Al-Ardiya area, Block (2), Street (6), Plot (88), House (11), Document No. (7533/1997), where one of the properties subject to the lawsuit is located. This was done in the presence and under the guidance of the first appellant's agent, Mr. Abd Al-Amir Alaiwi Shawardi <orig>عبد الأمير عليوي شاوردي</orig>. The remaining litigants were absent despite being notified of the session's date. We were accompanied by the Administration's expertise expert, Mr. Adel Al-Aslawi <orig>عادل العسلاوي</orig>. The inspection was conducted as follows:
The property subject to the lawsuit is an old private residence with an area of 750 square meters according to the document. The property overlooks one internal street and an alleyway (sikka). The exterior cladding of the property is Sigmachrome and Jordanian stone, and the air conditioning system is "window" type. It has an entrance from the street side and an entrance from the alleyway side. The property also has an unbuilt plot with an entrance on that side and an external door, which appears to be for the Diwaniya. The fourth side of the property is bordered by an adjacent neighbor. The property consists of a ground floor and a first floor. The inspection was conducted as follows:
The committee knocked on the door several times, but no one answered. The first appellant's agent was asked about enabling the committee to enter the property, and he stated that it is not in the possession of the first appellant and he cannot enable the committee to enter the property, limiting his role to providing guidance. The committee asked the Administration's expertise expert about the possibility of appraising the property's value by inspecting it from the outside only, and he stated that he could do so. He reviewed the previous expert report No. (2090/2017/F), which described the property's components.
The expertise expert took all necessary notes and reviewed the case file to submit the report for the valuation of the aforementioned property.

## Description of the Fifth Property:
6- Property under Document No. 14238/1997, located in the Salwa area – Plot No. 596 – Block No. 10 – Plan M/33808, with an area of 500 m², to be sold at public auction with a base price of KWD 540,000 (five hundred and forty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

The property subject to the lawsuit consists of two identical villas. The area of the property, according to the document, is 1000 square meters, at a rate of 500 square meters for each plot. The property overlooks two streets numbered (9 and 12) as well as an alleyway (sikka). It also has a garden. The property also has shaded parking for cars. The property consists of two villas, each comprising a basement, a ground floor, a first floor, and a second floor, all of which are identical. Each floor consists of two identical apartments, and each apartment is composed of three rooms in addition to a domestic worker's room with a bathroom, a living room, a kitchen, and two bathrooms. Each villa also has an electric elevator in addition to the staircase. The construction condition of the property is average and in good condition, and all apartments are leased.

Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.
Property Document No. 2009/3985 located in Al-Sabahiya <orig>الصباحية</orig> area – Plot No. 948 – Block No. 3 – from Plan No. M/26061, with an area of 375m², to be sold by public auction at a base price of (280,000 K.D.) two hundred and eighty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** As per the attached expert's report.
The property subject of the lawsuit, located in Al-Sabahiya <orig>الصباحية</orig> area, Block (3), Street (11), Plot (92), House (948), was inspected as follows:
The property conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to Document No. T 3985 and has an area of 375 square meters.
The property subject of the lawsuit is a private government residence located on a single street, with a limestone exterior facade, consisting of a ground floor, first floor, annex, and a courtyard with two entrances from the street.
The ground floor consists of 2 small halls, a bathroom, a kitchen, a storage room, and an annex comprising a hall, a kitchen, two bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and a laundry room, with a courtyard.
The first floor consists of a hall, 3 bedrooms, a bathroom, and a laundry room.
The property is in good condition and requires maintenance.
Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "
If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

## Announcement
Practice No. (WA/3-2025/2026)
Supply and Installation of Protective Shutters for the Exterior Fence and Entrances and Exits of Hawally Courts Complex <orig>مجمع محاكم حولي</orig>
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized establishments in this field its need for the supply, installation, and equipping of protective shutters for the exterior fence and the entrances and exits of the Hawally Courts Complex <orig>مجمع محاكم حولي</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications detailed in the practice documents. These documents can be obtained from the Tenders Department <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> – located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> Building, Block (14), Third Floor – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 11/5/2025, upon payment of a non-refundable subscription fee of (K.D. 75/-) only / seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>. Offers must be submitted to the Tenders Department <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> at the Ministry, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total offer value. This security deposit must remain valid throughout the offer's validity period of (90) days. The deadline for submitting offers is 1:00 PM on Monday, 2/6/2025.
Please note that a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters, in the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig>, Third Floor, at 11:00 AM on Monday, 19/5/2025. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions or recommendations resulting from the meeting, if any.
Director of Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>

## Announcement
### Practice No. (WA/2026-5/2025)

Supply, installation, inspection, and operation of spare parts for the repair of (3) three-phase uninterruptible power supply (UPS) devices and replacement of their attached batteries at the Public Prosecutions Complex building.
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and specialized institutions in this field its need for the supply, installation, inspection, and operation of spare parts for the repair of (3) three-phase uninterruptible power supply (UPS) devices and replacement of their attached batteries at the Public Prosecutions Complex <orig>مجمع النيابات العامة</orig> building, in accordance with the terms and specifications detailed in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders Section <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> – located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> building, Block (14), Third Floor – Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig>, during official working hours starting from Sunday, 2025/05/11, upon payment of a non-refundable subscription fee of (75/- K.D.) only / seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only. Offers must be submitted to the Tenders Section <orig>قسم العطاءات</orig> at the Ministry, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total value of the offer, provided that this security remains valid throughout the validity period of the offer (90) days. The final deadline for submitting offers is 1:00 PM on Monday, 2025/06/2.
Please note that a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters, in the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> located in the Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig>, Third Floor, at 10:00 AM on Monday, 2025/05/19. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions or recommendations resulting from the meeting, if any.
Director of Financial Affairs Department

Second: Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020).
Third: Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law (642030).

Fifth: Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiaries or to others, whether inside or outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> (642050).

Seventh: Business management office for holding activities (642070).
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.
