** The founders acknowledge their legal capacity to establish a Kuwaiti Holding Shareholding Company (K.S.C.C. - Kuwaiti Shareholding Company Closed) <orig>ش.م.ك. مقفلة</orig> among themselves and their commitment to the rules prescribed for its establishment in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its amendments and executive regulations.
They also acknowledge their commitment to all rules prescribed for the establishment of the company in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:

### Article (1)
The Preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.

### Article (2)
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 1 of 2016 and its executive regulations and their amendments, and the provisions of this contract.
The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of registration, and may not commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

### Article (3)
The company's name is: **Al-Rawdat Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضات القابضة</orig>** (A Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company), and its commercial address is State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company.

### Article (4)
The company's main center is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is "in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>". The Board of Directors may transfer the main center to any other location within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
The company's headquarters is considered its legal domicile, which is relied upon for directing correspondence and judicial notices to it and for registering its data in the Commercial Register. Any change to this headquarters shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

### Article (5)
The duration of this company is unlimited and commences from the date of (registration).

### Article (6)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 and its executive regulations and their amendments, the purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:

### Article (7)
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

### Article (8)
The company's authorized capital is set at KWD 2,100,000 (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 21,000,000 shares (Twenty-One Million Shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils (One Hundred Fils), and all shares are cash shares.
The issued capital is 21,000,000 shares (Twenty-One Million Shares) with a value of 100 fils (One Hundred Fils), and all shares are cash shares. The paid-up capital is KWD 525,000 (Five Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The paid-up capital was paid in cash by the shareholders into the company's bank account at Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig> as per a certificate issued by the bank on 2025/04/29.

### Article (9)
The founders signing this contract have subscribed to the entire issued capital of the company as follows:

It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such bodies or companies.

Article (5)
(b) Capital and Methods of Increasing It
The Company's authorized and issued capital is set at KWD 21,000,000 (twenty-one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), divided into 2,100,000 shares (two million one hundred thousand shares) with a nominal value of 100 fils per share. All shares are cash shares.
The paid-up capital is KWD 5,250,000 (five million two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). The Company's issued and paid-up capital consists of cash shares.

Article (6)
The Company's shares are nominal and of equal value, with the value of each share not less than one hundred fils. They may not be issued at a lower value unless approved by the regulatory authorities. (Non-Kuwaitis <orig>غير الكويتيين</orig> may not own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial decisions regulating thereof).

Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation, provided that it is supported by a resolution from the Company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to increase the issued capital within the limits of the authorized capital, and provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value.

Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the Company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and a report from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

Article (9)
The Company's capital is set at KWD 21,000,000 (twenty-one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only.
Company Share Distribution:

If a capital increase is decided, and some shareholders do not exercise their priority right to subscribe to the capital increase shares, the unsubscribed shares shall be allocated to those Company shareholders who wish to subscribe. If the subscription requests exceed the number of shares offered, they shall be allocated to the subscribers proportionally to their subscribed amount.
In all cases where the full new shares are not subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. The unsubscribed new shares shall be considered cancelled by operation of law.

Article (10)
The Company may increase its capital through subscription upon a request from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

Article (11)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> signing this contract undertake to carry out all necessary procedures to complete the establishment of the Company, and they commit to excluding and cancelling fictitious and duplicate subscription requests and taking the necessary measures to achieve this. For this purpose, they have authorized Mr. Hamoud Ahmed Rodhan Al-Rodhan <orig>حمود أحمد روضان الروضان</orig> to take legal actions, complete the necessary documents, and introduce any amendments that the official authorities deem necessary to be included in the contract or in the attached Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.
Within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed by each founder, a statement of the installments due, their names, addresses, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

Article (12)
The Company's founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall be jointly and severally liable among themselves for compensating any damage incurred by the Company, its shareholders, or third parties due to the invalidity of the Company's contract.

Article (1)
Al-Rodhan Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضان القابضة</orig>
Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company
Articles of Association
Establishment of the Company
A- Elements of the Company's Establishment
The Company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments, and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> between the shareholders whose provisions are set forth hereinafter, as a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company named: Al-Rodhan Holding Company <orig>شركة الروضان القابضة</orig>, a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company (K.C.S.C.).

Article (2)
The Company's head office and legal domicile are in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is the domicile considered for directing correspondence and judicial notices. A change in this domicile shall not be recognized unless the change is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may establish branches, agencies, or offices in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad.

Article (3)
The duration of this Company is unlimited and commences from the date of registration.

Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments, the objectives for which the Company was established are:
First: Managing subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing them with the necessary support (642010)
Second: Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities (642020)
Third: Owning real estate and movable assets necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law (642030)
Fourth: Accepting or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes, and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent (642040)
Fifth: Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other knowledge rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary companies or to others, whether within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad (642050)
Sixth: Owning shares solely for the account of the holding company <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> (642051).

and their opponents, the number of shares subscribed by each of them, the value of the share, and the amount paid towards its value.

Article (19)
The founders must invite the Constituent Assembly to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If this period expires without the Assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the aforementioned period, invite the Assembly to convene.

Article (20)
The invitation to attend the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1. Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2. Announcement, which must be made twice, provided that the second announcement is made after a period of no less than seven days from the date of publication of the first announcement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3. Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4. Any other modern means of communication specified in the Executive Regulations of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening, for the attendance of its representative.
The Constituent Assembly meeting shall be chaired by whomever the Assembly elects for this purpose.

Article (21)
The Constituent Assembly meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be invited to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Decisions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting. The meeting may be held using modern communication methods for shareholders, their proxies, representatives of the relevant regulatory bodies, the company's auditors, and anyone whose attendance is required.
This shall be in accordance with the rules and procedures specified in the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>.

Article (22)
The founders shall submit to the Constituent Assembly a report containing comprehensive information about all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location specified by the founders for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly shall be competent to address the following matters:
1. Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's articles of association.
2. Approving the valuation of in-kind shares, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3. Electing the members of the first Board of Directors.
4. Appointing the auditor and determining their fees.
5. Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly meeting, including the decisions taken, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The first Board of Directors must publish a contract that restricts the shareholder's right to dispose of their shares by one or both of the following restrictions:
1. Stipulating a right of priority for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2. Requiring the Board of Directors' approval for the buyer of the shares.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are exempted from these two restrictions.
(This provision does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange).

Article (12)
Before disposing of their shares, a shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

Article (13)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors, in the event of rejecting the buyer's person, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board is notified of the request for approval. In this case, the purchase shall be made at the price agreed upon by the shareholder for selling their shares.

Article (14)
Subscription
The founders who signed the articles of incorporation subscribed to the entire issued and paid-up capital of the company, consisting of 21,000,000 shares (twenty-one million shares), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio in the articles of incorporation. An amount of 525,000 K.D. (five hundred and twenty-five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed to has been paid into the company's bank account at Commercial Bank of Kuwait <orig>البنك التجاري الكويتي</orig>, as per the attached bank certificate dated 2025/04/29.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates specified by the Board of Directors. If a shareholder delays in paying the installment due on the shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of warning them, offer their shares for sale to the remaining shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholder, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall recourse against the shareholder for the remainder from their private assets.

Article (15)
Share ownership inevitably entails the shareholder's acceptance of the articles of incorporation, the provisions of the company's articles of association, and the resolutions of its General Assembly.

Article (16)
Each share grants its owner the right to an equal share to that of others, without discrimination, in the ownership of the company's assets and in distributed profits.

Article (17)
The company shall maintain a special register with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded. Any changes to the registered data shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register according to the information received by the company or the clearing agency. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency to provide them with data from this register.

Article (18)
Constituent Assembly
The founders must, within three months from the date of completion of the subscription and before the Constituent Assembly meeting, submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares they subscribed to, the payment of due installments by subscribers, and the names of the subscribers
<footer_start>
the company and its registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.
</footer_start>

### Article (24)
Rights and Obligations of Shareholders
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1.  Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares declared for distribution.
2.  Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors and attending general assemblies and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3.  Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' report, and the auditor's report.
4.  Disposing of shares owned by him and priority in subscribing to new shares.
5.  Receiving a share of the company's assets upon liquidation after settling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to the following:
1.  Paying installments due on shares owned by him upon their due dates and compensating for delay in payment.
2.  Paying expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments of his share value, and the company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3.  Implementing resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4.  Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1.  Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share.
2.  Decreasing the percentage of net profits to be distributed to shareholders as stipulated in the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3.  Imposing new conditions other than those mentioned in the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>, and authorizing deviation from these provisions with the acceptance of all shareholders or by a unanimous vote involving all shareholders, and fulfilling the necessary procedures to amend the company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (27)
A - Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> consisting of 3 members (three members), and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig>, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> may stipulate that no more than half of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members shall be elected from among the company's founders.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman <orig>رئيساً</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the Articles of Association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall act in place of the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from outside, entrusted with managing the company. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> shall define his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board <orig>المجلس</orig>.

### Article (32)
Any shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig> in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members chosen in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members who are elected. Shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> in electing the remaining Board members, except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as elected members.
The shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.

### Article (33)
A Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may use modern communication methods, and resolutions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (34)
Minutes of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. Any member who did not approve a resolution taken by the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may record his objection in the meeting minutes.

### Article (35)
If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member's position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder <orig>المساهمين</orig> who received the most votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete only the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call a General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> meeting within two months from the date of the last vacancy, and those who fill the vacant positions shall be elected.

### Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> membership:
1.  Must have legal capacity to act <orig>أهلية التصرف</orig>.
2.  Must not have been previously convicted of a felony involving deprivation of liberty <orig>جناية مقيدة للحرية</orig> or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud <orig>إفلاس بالتقصير أو التدليس</orig> or a crime against honor or trust <orig>جريمة مخلة بالشرف أو الأمانة</orig> or a penalty involving deprivation of liberty for violating the provisions of this law, unless his rehabilitation has been restored <orig>رد إليه اعتباره</orig>.
3.  Must personally own, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
4.  If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, his membership shall cease.

### Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الشركة</orig> shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article 234 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company <orig>شركة مساهمة مقفلة</orig>.

### Article (38)
The Chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not,

to exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain a benefit for himself or for others.
A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may dispose of his shares in the company during his membership in the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on the disposal of shares stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.

## Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they have become aware of due to their management of the company. Otherwise, they shall be dismissed and held accountable for compensating any damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for his own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from him or to consider the operations he carried out for his own account as if they were carried out for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon).
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, provided that it accurately includes a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages obtained by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.

## Article (42)
No person with representation on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the Chairman, or any member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or any member of the executive management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a license issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (43)
The company may not lend to any of its Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, or their affiliated companies, unless there is an authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good faith third parties.

## Article (44)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud and abuse of power, for every violation of the law or the company's articles of association, and for errors in management. The General Assembly's <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> vote to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not prevent the initiation of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those related to a special benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or to a dispute existing between them and the company.

## Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be personal, attaching to a specific member, or joint among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, unless a group of them objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

## Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> due to errors that

## Article (47)
Every shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to be awarded compensation if warranted. A shareholder may file his personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused him damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

## Article (48)
B – The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The Board may invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor, within twenty-one days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party.
The provisions related to founding assemblies stipulated in Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> No. 1 of 2016 and its executive regulations and amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and the quorum for attendance and voting.

## Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of his shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not delegate another person to attend on his behalf. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall issue the rules regulating the disclosures required for proxies for a shareholder's representative to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig>.
Any person claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

## Article (50)
Voting for candidates for Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> membership shall be subject to the cumulative voting system, which grants each shareholder voting power equal to the number of shares he owns, entitling him to cast these votes for a single candidate or distribute them among the candidates he chooses without duplicating these votes.

## Article (51)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or by a person delegated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for that purpose, or by a person elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> from among the shareholders or others.

## Article (52)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meeting, be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended fiscal year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violations detected by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.

7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors, and determining their remunerations.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors to do so.
9. Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties. Related parties are defined according to International Accounting Standards.

### Article (53)
By a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> of the company, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new board elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital.
If a resolution is issued to dissolve the Board of Directors, and it is not possible to elect a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until a new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee whose primary task shall be to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (54)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by one of the supervisory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes clear that the information related to some of the presented issues is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning one-quarter of the issued share capital. The postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (55)
The Board of Directors must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these Articles of Association <orig>هذا النظام</orig>.
The Board of Directors must re-present the violating resolutions to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.

### Article (56)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

### Article (57)
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (58)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders owning three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital.
Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Article (59)
Without prejudice to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2. Selling the entire project for which the company was established, or disposing of it in any other way.
3. Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

### Article (60)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (61)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of incorporation <orig>عقد تأسيس الشركة</orig>, or these Articles of Association <orig>هذا النظام</orig>, or if it is intended to harm the company's interests, and claim compensation when necessary.
Furthermore, resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority may be challenged. The challenge shall be made by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the issued capital, who have not approved those resolutions.

### Article (62)
**Company Accounts**
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the register and ends on December 31st of the following financial year.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The Assembly may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits. What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Additionally, one percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### Article (64)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (65)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws. A special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.

### Article (66)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.

### Article (67)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the financial year. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and this distribution shall not affect the company's paid-up capital or guarantee a financial period.

# Announcement of Sale by Sealed Bid Auction
## Auction No. (2462)

The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of office equipment - office furniture - wood piles - iron piles - aluminum piles - air conditioning units and other miscellaneous materials by sealed bid auction at the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> according to the following details:

1- Location for receiving the terms and conditions booklet and auction participation offer: Headquarters of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> - Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig> - Block 2, Street No. 20, opposite Oran Park <orig>حديقة وهران</orig> - Ground Floor, Financial Affairs, from 11/5/2025 until 15/5/2025. Documents are handed over for a non-refundable fee of (25) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> payable to the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> fund.
The bidder will sign a declaration and undertaking to adhere to the specified deadline for submitting the offer to the Central Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع المركزي</orig> at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> upon receiving the terms and conditions booklet.

2- Inspection Date: (5) working days from 11/5/2025 to 15/5/2025
Inspection Time: During official working hours from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM

3- Location for receiving those interested in inspecting the auction items: Headquarters of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> - Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig> - Block 2, Street No. 20, opposite Oran Park <orig>حديقة وهران</orig>.

4- Date for Submitting Offers and Opening Envelopes:
- Offers shall be submitted on Sunday, 18/5/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> - Block 12 - Third Floor - General Storage Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig> - Central Sales Section <orig>قسم البيع المركزي</orig>, according to the deadline set for the bidder by the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> (no offer will be accepted after the bidder's specified deadline).
- Envelopes will be opened and the auction held on Monday, 19/5/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> - Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> - Block 12 - Third Floor - General Storage Affairs Department <orig>إدارة شؤون التخزين العامة</orig>.
- The successful bidder will be announced on the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> website on Monday, 19/5/2025.
- Checks for unsuccessful bidders will be handed over on Tuesday, 20/5/2025.
- The certified check / bank guarantee shall be submitted in the name of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>.

- Special Conditions for the Auction:
  1. The bidder must be a registered Kuwaiti company or establishment - registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>. Foreign entities may participate provided they have a Kuwaiti partner or commercial agent with a notarized contract. (Required attachments: copy of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig> certificate, copy of the company's license, an accredited letter of authorization from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, all valid).
  2. Kuwaiti individuals are permitted to participate in the auction (a copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> must be attached).

# Decree-Law
## Article (68)
### Auditor
The provisions of Articles 227 to 233 of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> shall apply.

## Article (69)
At the end of each financial year, the company must prepare a consolidated balance sheet and profit and loss statements for itself and all its affiliated partners, accompanied by explanations and data as required by International Accounting Standards <orig>المعايير المحاسبية الدولية</orig>.

## Article (70)
### Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in Articles 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the articles of its executive regulations and their amendments.

## Article (71)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out in the manner specified by the provisions of Articles 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the articles of its executive regulations and their amendments.

## Article (72)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.

## Article (73)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. Any person wishing to obtain an identical copy may request it from the company for a specific fee determined by the company.

## Article (74)
The founders acknowledge the following:
Firstly: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the company's disposal.
Secondly: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the company's management.
Thirdly: Preservation of supporting papers and documents for the declarations submitted to the center with the official editor.

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Announcement
Announces the opening of nominations for honoring pioneering projects in the fields of social work and social development, which will be hosted by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> during 2025.
Types of projects are as follows: -
- Pioneering project in social work implemented by civil society organizations and institutions (voluntary sector).
- Pioneering project in social work implemented by commercial sector institutions (private sector).
Criteria and conditions for nominating the above-mentioned projects for honoring: -
1. The institution nominated for honoring must be from civil society and private sector institutions contributing to community work, social responsibility, and development efforts.
2. The institution must have provided significant services to the community in the field of community development.
3. The institution must have presented or developed an existing project in its fields of work.
4. The contributions and services provided must be voluntary contributions, or within the scope of social responsibility, or developing aspects of the national economy.
Fields of projects eligible for nomination: -
1. Innovative ideas for pioneering development projects in the field of development.
2. Development projects in the field of social care homes and social rehabilitation centers.
3. Development projects concerned with childhood and its services.
4. Projects that support social partnership and civil society institutions.
5. Projects that defend the rights of marginalized or vulnerable social groups and work to empower them.
6. Charitable projects in community development.
It is stipulated that the projects referred to in this announcement, for which works are honored, must be clear - capable of media prominence - (non-profit), as only two institutions will be honored in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, one for each of the two sectors (civil voluntary - commercial private).
Nomination forms must be completed and sent to the Department of Foreign Relations <orig>إدارة العلاقات الخارجية</orig> at the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>, noting that the deadline for receiving nomination forms is the end of May 2025. They can also be sent via email in accordance with the conditions outlined in the general framework for honoring.
For more information, please visit the following: -
Ministry's website: www.mosal.gov.kw
Ministry's Instagram: mosal_mc_q8
For review and inquiries, please contact the Department of Foreign Relations <orig>إدارة العلاقات الخارجية</orig>:
Tel: (22484877/23) Fax: (22450763)
Email: Foreign.relations.@mosal.gov.kw
Public Relations Department <orig>إدارة العلاقات العامة</orig>

*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for the Care and Development of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise. # Directorate General of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
## Public Auction Announcement

The Directorate General of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> announces that on Wednesday, 14/5/2025, at 11:00 AM, goods consisting of the following will be sold:

<table_caption>Public Auction Items from Directorate General of Customs</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Quantity | Type | Goods Type |
|:--|:-----|:-----|:---|
| 1 | 176 | Carton | Assorted Cigarettes |
| 2 | 1 | 40-foot Container | Soap Compressor |
| 3 | 2 | 40-foot Container | Plywood and Iron Wood Roll (Scrap) |
| 4 | 1 | 20-foot Container | Wooden Doors |
| 5 | 1 | 20-foot Container | Iron Roll |
| 6 | 1 | 40-foot Container | Iron Wire, Wooden Roll, and Drums |
| 7 | 1 | 40-foot Container | Assorted Goods |
| 8 | 2 | 40-foot Container | Electrical Transformer Frames |
</table>

by public auction at the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department, affiliated with the Directorate, located at Sulaibiya <orig>الصليبية</orig>, Sixth Ring Road.
Therefore, those wishing to purchase should attend the auction site on the specified date, taking into account the following terms of sale:
1. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the circumstances of the sale.
2. The successful bidder shall bear a brokerage commission of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder must pay the value of the goods only via K-Net, as determined by the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder must remove the goods from the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department headquarters urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
6. The Directorate has the right to stop, postpone, or reschedule the sale at another time if a suitable price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interests.
7. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
8. Since the goods will be sold as-is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain their condition, quality, and type, at the address mentioned above, during the auction sale.
9. In the event that the successful bidder refrains from paying the sale price or part thereof, the Directorate General of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to re-sell the goods at their expense. If the price does not reach the amount at which the auction was initially awarded, they shall be obliged to pay the difference. In this case, the Directorate has the right to bar them from participating in any future auction.
10. The Directorate is not responsible for any action or use of the goods that violates applicable laws and legislations.
11. This sale shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 concerning the Unified Customs System <orig>النظام الموحد للجمارك</orig> and its regulating decisions.
12. All bidders must adhere to health and preventive requirements.

Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>

## Announcement from the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig>
Regarding the Maintenance of the Website of the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> and its Sub-Sites
The General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (17-2024-2025) regarding the maintenance of the website of the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> and its sub-sites, in accordance with the special and general specifications and conditions contained in the practice documents, available from the headquarters of the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> in Dasma <orig>الدسمة</orig> area / Block 6, Hamoud Al-Raqaba <orig>حمود الرقبة</orig> Street, Second Floor – Financial Department – Procurement Section – during official working hours, for a non-refundable fee of (75.000 K.D.) starting from Sunday, 2025/5/11. Bids must be submitted to the General Secretariat of Awqaf <orig>الأمانة العامة للأوقاف</orig> before 1:00 PM on Thursday, 2025/5/22.
The preliminary guarantee for this bid is (2%) of the bid value and must be valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Those wishing to obtain the terms and conditions booklet are requested to bring the following documents:
- Copy of the registration application in the Secretariat's suppliers' register.
- Copy of the commercial register certificate.
- Copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
- Copy of the labor support certificate.

# General Command of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>
## Announcement
The General Command of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the offering of Qualification No. (2-2025/2026) for Gulf training centers to hold conferences and training programs outside the State of Kuwait, in accordance with the conditions stated in the qualification documents.
Therefore, companies wishing to participate in the tender must register on the General Command of the National Guard's website (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the tender documents for a non-refundable amount of (K.D. 3,500) only three thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars. Payment is to be made through the National Guard's website using the (K-NET) service.
The preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 20/5/2025, at 10:00 AM, at the General Command of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> building - Digital - Faisal Al-Jareed Building. The tenderer, whether present or not, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications included in the meeting. Furthermore, participating companies must print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the General Command of the National Guard's website (www.kng.gov.kw).
Note:
No single person or group of persons combined may submit more than one bid in the tender, except for alternative bids if permitted by the tender conditions, in accordance with Article (29) of Law No. (49) of 2016 concerning Public Tenders.
For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999) extension 66734.
Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 17/06/2025.
Note:
Bring the purchase receipt and an authorization letter from the training center for its representative to attend the meeting.
For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999) extension (66983), Fax (24999858) 66769, Mobile: (66270006).

The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> announces the extension date and the date for receiving Addendum No. (1) for Tender No.: PAHW / M / 1425-2025/2026, concerning the supply, extension, and maintenance of 400 kV underground cables for the South Al-Rishain <orig>جنوب الريشين</orig> 400 kV substation (2Z, 3Z) in the South Sabah Al-Ahmad Residential Project <orig>مشروع جنوب صباح الأحمد السكنية</orig>, which was advertised in Issue No. (1734) dated 2025/04/13.

- Closing date for submission of bids: 2025/06/18 instead of 2025/05/18
- Date for receiving Tender Addendum No. (1): 2025/05/22

Companies invited to the aforementioned tender must attend the headquarters of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> – Third Floor – Documents and Contracts Department <orig>إدارة الوثائق والعقود</orig> – to receive Tender Addendum No. (1) starting from the above-mentioned date, bringing with them the receipt for purchasing the tender documents. # Kuwait Petroleum International <orig>شركة البترول الكويتية العالمية</orig>
Announcement regarding the list of companies invited to participate in Limited Tender No. KPI-HR-07042025 <orig>المناقصة المحدودة رقم KPI-HR-07042025</orig> for the provision of recruitment services to Kuwait Petroleum International <orig>شركة البترول الكويتية العالمية</orig>.

The Higher Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig>, upon a request from Kuwait Petroleum International (KPI) <orig>شركة البترول الكويتية العالمية</orig>, one of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation's <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> companies, announces the list of companies invited to participate in Limited Tender No. KPI-HR-07042025 <orig>المناقصة المحدودة رقم KPI-HR-07042025</orig> for the provision of recruitment services to Kuwait Petroleum International <orig>شركة البترول الكويتية العالمية</orig>. In this regard, we draw attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article 16 of Law No. 49 of 2016 <orig>القانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016</orig> concerning Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>, the aforementioned tender will be issued to the following list of companies, totaling 22 companies, at least 30 days from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>.
